Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location, near metro and less then a block from Vatican city”
Reviews.Author: MARIA2012LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last week, with my sister and nephew. Staff was very nice. Breakfast was served from 7-10:00am, sometimes it was served pass 10am which was great for us going from California and suffer getting up due to time change. LOL. Hotel was nice and clean, got clean towels every day. Walking distance to Vatican City less than 1 block. Near metro station and many local restaurants. Next door to hotel theirs a small store where you can buy groceries, candies, cosmetics etc. that's a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Banshee123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights while visiting Rome and loved our visit. I think most complaints on this site are not warranted. We had a quad room that was clean, spacious (for Rome!) and well appointed. We experience no problems while at this hotel. The front desk staff was extremely helpful, even to the point of storing our luggage for a day and calling some local museums to check time and ticket information. The location is excellent, within a stones throw of the Vatican Museum entrance. It's also very close to two metro stops that will get you to any location in Rome very quickly. There are plenty of local restaurants near as well. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect air conditioning!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at Spring House on Feb 25, 2012 for the week of 3/23/12-3/29/12. I called to take advantage of the 21 day discount for early booking but they told me to go on line to book and they would work it out when I arrived. Now, mind you...I was quoted a price of $169 American not Euro. We arrived two days after my daughter & her husband. On arrival, I was surprised to see a fan in their room and it was HOT! It seems the hotel had not turned on the air yet and we were have 70 degree days. My room was on the 6th floor and it was hot also...the room was also "set up" with two twin beds pussed together when I had booked to full beds. I told them I had asked to two separate beds...I had no idea that it would be "twin" beds and I mean little twin beds. After my complaint about the heat and the bed...they came...they separated the two "twin" beds with new linens...and brought a rotating fan. I asked when the air would be on...and I was informed by two people at the desk...that it was a LAW that they could not turn on the air yet....I simply asked...show me the "law" and I will understand. I was promised a copy of the law...it never happened. All in all, the breakfast was good, staff ...there (dinning) kind and attentive. Maid was OK...but on return I was missing a new small shirt I purchased for my granddaughter...I searched every piece in my luggage and the bag of presents for the other family members...All the other presents were there and the wrapping which had been on the shirt was there but no shirt...I have contacted the hotel to ask them to "look" for the shirt. I made sure to check the closet and under the bed for missing articles...None found prior to leaving. I also took a coat hanger and used it to feel for anything in the top of the closet...So I am very disappointed in this hotel...Also,The hotel debited my American Express the day of the booking for the full price..and when I got my bill ...I was charged more for thr first three days(E153) and (E145) for the remaing four days because he said it was the last room and he could charge more. I explained that he had pulled the money for my room a month earlier!.. On top of that, I had to pay an additional 2 Euros per person per day. (E 4). So beware ....the room cost me well over $200 (American) instead of the quoted $169. Find another hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “our 6 day experience”
Reviews.Author: Heather W
Reviews.Content: Clean, helpful employees. Bottom rooms have windows way up, can't see out. The rooms are classically european small, but at the end of the day you are only crashing there right.... Breakfast more american like than european, they are very attentive. 2 blocks from the vatican museums a grocery store on the same block and not a bad area either to walk around. Be sure to go to the Pasturella restaurant, good dinners there. Wonderful servers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: JoyceofLife
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Best Western Springhouse (March 20-24). I have to admit that I was nervous because I read one review that was not positive. I am happy to report that we had a very nice stay at the hotel. I found it to be very clean. The room was very small and the walls were a bit thin but overall our stay was very nice. Everyone at the front desk was more than helpful. Also, the location is ideal to visit the Vatican and we could walk to the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, the Spanish Steps and every major attaction. We took the Metro to the Coliseum and it was easy and close.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but.....”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got a good deal on a junior suite from March 9th until March 12th 2012. We were given room 107 on the ground floor. We arrived early but we were instructed that we could not check in before 15:00 that day so we left our luggage and took a stroll around the area. We got back around 16:00 and checked in. Tried to take a nap at this point but it was impossible as the hotel had renovations going on in what sounded like the room next door. The noise of beating lump hammers, kango hammers and drilling made it impossible to get any sort of shut eye. We decided not to let this ruin our first day so we got out of there for the night. Saturday morning 8:00am and the hammers and drilling started off again.This went on for the entire day until 17:30/18:00. Thankfully Sunday was quiet and we left early on Monday morning.While the hotel staff were friendly I think the hotel have some nerve charging to stay in a junior suite and have that racket going on next to the room, I don't care what they needed to do, it should have been pointed out to us that this would be going on during our stay and a price reduction given. Also they boast a huge bath tub in the junior suite bathroom but with the poor water pressure it would take in the region of an hour or so to actually fill it to a point where you could take a bath!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneCC
Reviews.Content: The room was small but well appointed. The night we arrived the staff member was very pleasant after a long journey to the hotel. The breakfast was great. The air-conditioning only works in the summer months so it was a bit warm-had to keep the windows open which was noisy. Overall, the hotel was very nice and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more...”
Reviews.Author: blacky1971
Reviews.Content: Good location, good breakfast, very helpful staff. But that's all. The room was too small for 4 people, the toilet was not working properly, and the worst was that it was DIRTY! The pillows were dirty, the bathroom was not as clean as it should be, and the dust was dancing under the beds! For 150 euros per night I expected at least to be clean!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BraulloBogart
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Springhouse last week with my wife and mom, and we enjoyed staying there. Sure its a little far from the Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps and other tourist spots, but its a 5 minute walk to the Vatican, and one of my favorites, the Old Bridge gelateria. It is also near a Metro station, so if you dont mind taking the Metro, you can easily go around Rome while staying in this hotel. The neighborhood is safe and quiet, and the staff are friendly and helpful. Plus they have very reasonable rates. I wouldn't mind staying in this hotel again when i return to Rome. The only negative comment i have is that the shower room is too small

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good price, good room!”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Lorenzo
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets a lot of things going right for it. Very good location as it is just 10 minutes walk from Vatican City, there is also a supermarket right next door if you ever need anything. Services are all there, breakfast, free wifi, laundry and even balcony! It is the perfect base to spend a day or two to go sightseeing Rome. From here you can go to Vatican City by walking, then catch many of those Open Bus tour operators and go everywhere there are to see in Rome. You won't go wrong as a first timer here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DragonJack
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for 1 night in Jan 2012. We had a family room which was the same as having two rooms with an interconnecting door (so each room had a bathroom, which was great). We got a great rate on this hotel so I was a little concerned. I need not have worried as it was very nice indeed. Everything has been modernised beautifully, including a lovely bathroom. The rooms were not huge, but big enough, with a decent sized wardrobe and even a small balcony! The lobby is modern, but small, and the lift is tiny and very slow. Very nice breakfast was included in the rate. Easy walk to the Vatican and just around the corner from the Vatican museum. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “new year's 2012 Fine, yes small but if Vatican loca is important”
Reviews.Author: CatinRzeszow
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights with my 77 yr old mother over New Year's - am European 3rd time in Rome. vatican loca was important as was balcony (smoker) room 'spring room' was a lot smaller than expected for the price but - surprise the mini-bar was totally free and restocked - if you are winter or too tired to go out and about - there is not much of interest in the vicinity - the market next door doesn't have a deli - if you can go 2 blocks away from the 'walls' to via Andrea Doria and turn left for a full Despar deli shop - just have your own plastic cutlery whatever and plates. you'll have plenty of drinks in the minibar - the place next door has beer/wine.. staff very nice, especially at breakfast which yes is full as others wrote. this time of year - yes do take hats and gloves .. you can certainly walk to everywhere from here - and yes metro is a 5-10 min walk as is Vatican proper. as they say - even with my mother - you will walk everywhere. neighborhood here really has nothing so if you for going out it's not for you. ok - one 'serious' issue was the arranging of the taxi via the hotel for airport pick-up. They weren't there. Having a Euro cell-phone I called and asked - a call back - sorry! driver is not coming - take a taxi! well we wasted a half hour or whatever. THEN - the hotel price was 55 euro, taking whomever from the airport - 41. better to tip than.. arranged return via www.romeairportcabs.com not trusting the hotel for a 4 a.m. New Year's Day departure.. this service was great - so many confirmations, etc, more than on time - ok at 4 am. 50 euro not 40 as on the website but still cheaper than the hotel service which - did not come. oh - the electricity went out twice during our 5 night stay. just call the desk and tell them ; ) it's a fine place - having a balcony was nice - it's 1/3 the size of the small room, wi-fi works ok - have to keep logging on but it does work. A dream place? no. But if the Vatican is the center of your journey then ok. It is a good walk still to it, but. have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “a nice place, very convenient for the Vatican museum”
Reviews.Author: gian63trav
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at sSpring House Hotel. We got a room at first floor with a double bed + an additional bed for our daughter. Room was very clean and during our stay it has been well mainteined.Bathroom with shower is bit small. Staff is very frienldy and nice, Breakfast is offered in good quantity and with a quite good choice. The main reason for me for recommending this hotel is its excellent location, extremly convenient for visiting Vatican museum as well as the Vatican area. Hotel is located about 100 mt from the entrance of Vatican museum and it is walking distance from San Pietro church and square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but really disorganized”
Reviews.Author: Alexander T
Reviews.Content: Ludicrous. The good thing is proximity to the Vatican and St Peter’s. Bad things? Being checked in only at 3 (we were only checked in at 4.30 in fact, and then to the wrong room), disorganization and a generally poor condition. Our shower head fell off continuously, and the shower door did not close properly (etc etc etc). Most staff were quite unfriendly, except for Paulo who was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast, as usual in Europe, was tiny. I know European service is generally not good, but I think punctuality, professionalism and general upkeep are things that should be expected - and these things are very variable here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to the Vatican and Subway.”
Reviews.Author: JeffyLA
Reviews.Content: Had a great week stay at this hotel. The room was clean and well kept, however the shower was a bit small. Breakfast and wait staff were also great, selection was above and beyond the average Best Western. The hotel is located within 10 mins from the Vatican Museum and 20 to St Peters. The subway is a short 10 minute walk, along with multiple bus stops. The subway stops nightly at 9pm, until April 2012, however buses back are easy to catch from the center of Rome. November was a great time to visit, little or no lines and few beggars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Staff, Wonderful Rooms and an Awesome Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jay M
Reviews.Content: Stay here and be happy! Walking distance to The Vatican. Walking distance to the subway. Great restaurants less than a five minute walk. Stayed here and were pleasantly surprised! Paulo was very helpful in letting us experience Rome. He recommended things to see and fantastic restaurants! Hot breakfast every morning with eggs, meats, rolls, yogurt, fruit and tomatoes and Mozzarella in olive oil! Yummy!!!

Reviews.Title: “In the words of the song, (well almost) ... Amichevole Roma”
Reviews.Author: Impavid574
Reviews.Content: We went here because of the reviews and thankfully they were pretty accurate. The best thing was the friendly and helpful staff - particularly the eager-to-please receptionist and the desperate-to-please bartender. The location is great for the Vatican and bus and metro stops to go elsewhere. Restaurants in the area are a bit pricey but Trestevere is only a bus ride away. Rome is a city short on space - all the shops have narrow frontages and, reflecting that, the hotel bedrooms aren't suitable for cat-swinging. They were clean and comfortable, though the views were grim. Breakfasts were great - lots of variety to suit all tastes and as much as you could eat, so even the Yanks were happy. The hotel lounge was more of a corridor, but then I guess you don't go to Rome to relax in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation & cleaning of adjoining rooms...moody staff...awkward showers”
Reviews.Author: Aussie1960
Reviews.Content: Friends who had stayed previously at Spring House had recommended it to me so I stayed for 4 nights in late October before a cruise departing from the nearby port of Civitavecchia. I had a single room which is narrow & long but ok for one person.You have to use the wardrobe for storage of luggage as the room is narrow & has limited room.I enjoyed all aspects of my stay... In late November I stayed one night & this time booked a city room which because it was off season was about the same price as the per night rate of the single room in October.. When I arrived at about 11am there were three people at reception complaining about noise issues with their room..this was resolved with them being moved to another room on the 6th floor but their luggage was being left in the current room until they came back later in the day...( I don`t usually eavesdrop on conversations but am mentioning it here as it is relevant to the issues I experienced)..As my room wasn`t ready they offered to store my luggage.. I left $3USD tip at the front desk as a tip for the bell boy as I assumed my luggage would be delivered once the room was ready..I also gave $5USD tip to the front desk as I had a pleasant stay in October... I went sightseeing to the Vatican which is close by & arrived back at the hotel at 3.15pm to check in..I was given the key for room 116 on the 1st floor & proceeded up to the room to find the maid in the process of cleaning it & then reacting somewhat hysterically when I arrived..there was luggage in the room that was not mine?? So a staffer apologised & said that my room would be ready shortly & offered me a free drink at the bar while I waited...not long after they told the barman that my room was ready & I proceeded up to the room..My luggage wasn`t there so I rang the front desk & the bell boy brought up the luggage..I told him that I had left a tip for him at the front desk & he said that he had not received any tip & I said that I had left one for him & his response was no!! no!!..his attitude was not very good at all..Soon I noticed grinding noises,hammering etc.. from the adjoining room & went out into the corridor to find that the room next door was being renovated as well as 2 or 3 other rooms adjacent & dust all over the floor in the corridor.. I was tired & had wanted to have a afternoon sleep which was impossible with all the various & at times very loud noises coming from the adjoining rooms...I rang the front desk who told me it would only be for about another 20mins (at about 4pm) & it continued so I rang asking could they please give me a idea of when the noise would cease & was told that the workmen would leave by 8pm..after the tradesmen left the bell boy was in there cleaning & vacumning & this went on until he finished at about 11pm...I rang the front desk twice again & they apologised but didn`t do anything about the noise..I had to be up early the next day for my flight out of Rome..when I checked out I told the guy that I was very disappointed with the noise & he apologised..When I booked the 2 stays in special request option I had requested "Quiet Room Please".Also as the people in the room before me were moved to another room why wasn`t I assigned to a room that I had booked originally??? rather then being placed in the room with the renovation noise problem???? I was really annoyed that all they could do was make excuses & not do anything about the excessive noise & inconvenience I experienced...this was very very disappointing & has made me consider whether I would stay at this hotel again considering this bad experience... Also in regards to the shower in room 116 the shower doors open from the front corner & the doors do not open fully so I found that I had to turn sideways & breath in to get in & out of the shower!! I am 6feet tall & 220 pounds..So anyone with a big build beware & anyone with a large stomach could find that they cannot get in to the shower recess at all...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Big_bot
Reviews.Content: Very small but clean room. Excellent location, only 5 min from Vatican Museum. Metro station not too far away. And if you like bacon and eggs on breakfast this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations, outstanding breakfast, fine service”
Reviews.Author: Stryguy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with pleasant rooms (some on the small side), immaculate baths (again, small by US standards), and a wonderful breakfast. Free internet, free loaner bicycles (two), excellent and friendly staff. The breakfast is ample, varied, and will last you well into the afternoon. Just don’t try to serve yourself coffee – the staff likes to do that! I have the impression that in the US Best Western is a budget choice. (I’ve never stayed there.) This hotel is very like a boutique hotel, with stylish furniture and décor, definitely upscale. The staff is very helpful, and they can get you a car (not a taxi) to the airport for a very reasonable 50 Euros. This is worth it, trust me-- we arrived via bus and subway; cheap, but very tiring. Call or email before you go and arrange for them to have a car pick you up at the airport and whisk you right to their front door. The location is very good – away from the hustle and bustle of the Termini area, on a quiet side street, and in a real neighborhood. The subway is a short walk away, but the problem is you have to walk a lot after you arrive on the other end (unless you’re going to the Coliseum). But then, you will walk a lot in Rome no matter what you do. Of course, the Vatican Museum is a very short walk away. We felt this hotel was an excellent choice, and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: 1957Doug
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Vatican. The staff was helpful, knowledgeable, and customer focused. The room was clean and well done. The one drawback is that the shower was very small. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagicGirl57
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the Best Western Spring House and had a great time there. This was our first visit to Rome and a special anniversary for us, we were not disappointed with our accomodation. We had a lovely room on the sixth floor, with a good size terrace. The welcome fruit basket was a nice touch. The bathroom was rather cramped, but the bed very comfortable. It was a short easy walk to the Vtaican and St peters which meant we could beat the crowds. Excellent breakfast and helpful and frinedly staff at all times. The area was safe at night and convenient for Metro. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Proximity to Vatican is great”
Reviews.Author: ccumomsc
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it offered a triple room, which is difficult to find in Europe. The Vatican is only a couple blocks away which also was a deciding factor. Pluses-Clean room, large towels, free WI-FI, free breakfast which provided enough to fill you up to start your day, cafe is reasonably priced and will deliver to your room. They set up our transfer to the airport for us and the driver was prompt and professional. It was not a city taxi but a private car and only 50 euros. Negatives-The pillows are terrible, flat and hard, elevator is tiny and extremely slow. We had room #145. One wall borders on an apartment. You could hear the shouting and baby cries right through the shower venting. Don't exchange any currency at the front desk, they rip you off. We would probably not stay there again but only because Rome is so large and we like to try out new areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing outstanding, but GREAT location near Vatican!”
Reviews.Author: JClift
Reviews.Content: Ok, not the best neighborhood, not terribly close to Metro/bus stops, no outstanding views, adequate room/bath and the service was ok. The breakfast was pretty good. BUT this hotel is just a hop, skip and a jump away from St. Peters and the Vatican! And very near some fun little restaurants. We had fabulous pizzas and antipasti at area spots! I would suggest to the front desk to maybe offer some suggestions for restaurants and/or offer an area map to your guests. Other than that, I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Spring House”
Reviews.Author: JSTTexas
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good with lots of choices including eggs and bacon. The room was small (as typical for Europe) but clean. The rooms were quiet. The bar was quaint. The only negative was the people next door had a purse and another small item which disappeared from their room. We did not have any problems and used the in room safe. The location is excellent for the Vatican, and is close to excellent food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 635MNM
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It is a short walk to the walls of the Vatican, and the hub for hop on- hop off bus tours. Underground parking is available (20 euros/day) and computer use is free. The hotel bar is well stocked and offers a variety of specialty drinks and foods. Benny, the bartender/chef is experienced and accommodating. His friendly personality brought us back to the bar each night to relax after touring. Our bathrooms were very tiny with difficult shower access.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: SW_Sydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family here for one week. The hotel was good value for money and and was very close to Vatican City (eg St. Peters, Vatican Museum, etc...). Its not the most attractive area in Rome and is fairly light on for good quality food choices, but if you are willing to use the metro and buses (easy to use and very cheap), it isn't too hard to spend your days and nights in some of the better areas for attractions and food. I don't normally eat in the hotels but as there was limited choice around we used the breakfast service at Spring House. It was reasonably priced and not too bad..... hold out for coffee at one of the local espresso bars. Rooms were fairly small (we had the quad family room), but were clean and in good condition. AC was good and free WiFi worked well. The room safe is very small and they do not have a larger one at the front desk. We were traveling with just a Macbook Air 11" and it wouldn't fit in the room or front desk safe. Staff were friendly and helpful with the exception of the guy on the desk on the last evening. His behaviour was the only low point of this hotel. His attitude was terrible and when we asked him about booking the driver for the airport the following day, he became rude. The rest of the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Prashan_raj
Reviews.Content: Rooms : we had a fashion room and a twin room. The twin room was spacious and very neat. The fashion room was FANTASTIC ! ! with a fully retractable sun roof in the upstairs bedroom and a huge bathroom. Breakfast : Breakfast was a nice spread ranging from hot and cold foods. Location : Extremely convenient for Metro and a minute's walk to the Vatican Museum. Service : The staff were excellent. Very friendly, helpful and all at the reception spoke English as well. Ricardo was great and made our stay at the hotel special.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: kathleen p
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay at the Springhouse. Maurizio warmly checked us in after a long flight from the states. We went to the small restaurant and met Benny who made us feel right at home and always had a smile for us. Sergio was wonderful in the morning and knew exactly what we wanted in the morning after our first day. Overall, a great place to stay, rooms clean, nice bedding and thirsty towels. We liked the area that it is located, close to the Vatican and to the bus line. The staff was helpful with whatever we asked. The price was very reasonable and the food was delicious when we were too tired from sightseeing to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay when visiting Vatican”
Reviews.Author: DavidS1948
Reviews.Content: Nice, helpful staff, clean rooms, sufficient breakfast buffet. The staff did an outstanding job coordinating arrival information and setting up transportation from airport to Hotel and Hotel to Port. The Hotel has an excellent location near the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: cedars52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of August post cruise after staying pre-cruise at a different hotel in a more central part of Rome. This hotel was picked because of the tripadvisor reviews and because we were doing the Vatican tours. We arrived before lunch post cruise and the roon was not ready so we waited in the lobby. After about 2 hours we enquired and we told it was ready (we probably would have sat there several more hours had we not asked). The roon was a studio with a loft. They took the couch from the lobby when we arrived and put it on the main floor of our unit. The bed was up open stair to a loft platform-not great for getting up to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. The logistics of the unit were unusual and not very comfortable. The bed was ok with decent bedding. The mini bar was complimentary with a selection of water juice and beer. Wi-fi was free. The breakfast was good. The cafe was limited and we did not use it . The location was great for the Vatican however the area was a bit run down with trash in the streets. We had emailed that we were celbrating our 25th and unlike our previous hotel there was no acknowledgement. The bathroom was huge though the useable space -no shelves-poor lighting made it difficult to use. There is a huge bathtub that is awkward and without jets so is somewhat pointless. The staff tried to be helpful. I would likely choose somewhere else due to the logistics of the room and sketchiness of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in the Spring (at the Spring House)...how appropriate!”
Reviews.Author: dannieboysreviews
Reviews.Content: I was concerned going solo in the big city of Rome. No need to be concerned. I picked the hotel for the location. A couple of blocks from the Vatican and some very nice cozy places to eat in the surrounding neighborhood. Angelo never let me leave the restaurant without a shot of Grappa (not for the timid). The rooms were nice (minibar included in my rooms price). I did splurge for one of the higher end rooms and do not regret the decision. There is a "bar/restaurant" on property with limited fare. The staff was helpful and able to meet my needs. Little market next door so you can buy things to have in your room. Would definitely stay here again. Rome has always been on my bucket list but I left some things unseen so I will have to leave it on my list to return to one day. Bring comfortable shoes. I walked from the Spanish steps stopping at all points to the Circus Maximus and back. Kept meaning to stop and catch a cab but just kept walking and walking. All of the venues were awesome. Being able to see the sights (Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Colliseum, etc. ) was wonderful. You walk down an alley enjoying the architecture, mixing the old and new together, turn the corner and there you are faced with a marvelous sight. The Trevi Fountain was most definitely the busiest venue I visited. I must say I was shocked at how "Al Dente" the italians like their pasta. It definitely has a toothsomeness to it. I was ready to call the waiter back on my first pasta order and tell them they undercooked it but noted a pattern fairly quickly. It takes a bit of time to get used to eating pasta with that much bite. I stayed five days and May was a great time of year to go.

Reviews.Title: “At the Vatican's back door!”
Reviews.Author: computerprofessor
Reviews.Content: I wanted to see the Vatican and this hotel is only about a half block from the back door. I say "the back door" because you have to go through the museum first, and it's really on the outside of Vatican city. Really suggest you read up on the dress code, as I saw many people in shorts or tank tops being denied entry. Enjoyed the hotel, fair rates and a very good buffet. As in most European hotels, you have to bring your own washcloth. They have towels, but nothing small to wash with. I carry a couple in a Ziploc bag, just to make sure. I guess it's an American thing. It's a clean and nice place, with good service. The front desk is helpful and the neighborhood is safe to walk around in. The Metro, buses and taxi's are all within a block or two.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it. It made our initial European trip very homey.”
Reviews.Author: skyekuya
Reviews.Content: We really stayed here in August of 2009. I forgot to write a review. Well, the place was very clean and comfortable. It's close to St. Peter's Basilica and Sistine Chapel. It's close to a lot of restaurants. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. I would love to stay there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: zavareh
Reviews.Content: Good location for visiting Vatican and castle sant Angelo. Near to Metro (Cipro), friendly and useful stuff, air condition (well a bit noisy!) but quiet street anyway to have a good sleep. Our triple room was the same size as double (third bed was not good enough), free internet connection (signal strength was no so good, My laptop could connect but iPad not).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaSequin
Reviews.Content: After reading all the doom and gloom reviews on here I was really worried what we would be experiencing. I had emailed the hotel to ask for connecting rooms (as we were bringing our two teenage boys), and a higher position with balcony (after reading the tips on the tripadvisor). I further emailed them to ensure the air conditioning would be working in both rooms as it was a concern to many travellers. They had obviously listened to everything, they also overide the air conditioning as it was very cool when we arrived and we didnt have to put our key in to activate it. We had a family room - 2 rooms with connecting doors, standard size room, quite small all around but adequate - it seemed bigger as we had the door open to the boys room. Small balcony with two chairs (only prob in afternoon constant shade so if you want to sunbath do it in the morning). Staff all pleasant. Breakfast room small, hot and crowded, it was difficult to get seated together. Be aware that the Metro finished at 9,30 and we had to bus it across Rome to get to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location and Value”
Reviews.Author: im6048cd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Hotel Spring House for 7 nights the last leek of June 2011. This was our first trip to Europe .(Family of 4, Parents and 2 daughters 18 and 10). We knew going in not to expect hotels rooms the size of US rooms so we were not surprised by the size. We booked the family room and I would recommend this for anyone travelling with kids. We arrived early so the hotel stored our luggage while we walked around the city. I did my research before the trip so we pretty much knew where and how to reach points of interest. Walking is best way to get around, but we also bought the Romapass and this was great for taking the underground metro trains and skipping th lines at museums. Metro Station is very close to the hotel and we felt perfectly safe in the neighborhood. Location is great for vistiting Vatican city and museum. Staff was friendly and helpful. Front desk helped answer all our questions and called cabs when needed ( we visited the catacombs of st priiscilla and a taxi is the best way to get there). Benny was great. He even spotted us walking around the city on is day off and made sure to say hi. Free breakfast made for a great start everyday. As Rome is very expensive, we had a big breakfast everyday, snacks at midday and then out for dinner every night. Thank god for the free internet access too or else my eldest might have freaked out, not being able to talk to her boyfriend evernight. I recommend taking the train to Florence for a day. Kiosks at the station make buying tickets easy. I have no problem recommending this hotel and would stay here again if travelling with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: trunik
Reviews.Content: We had 6rooms booked in this hotel the location was the only positive for this hotel. The 1st night we were put in a room meant for 2 and we were 2adults & 2 kids. We could not walk,open bags and onto of it all the air condition was not working. After complaining they gave us a fan so which was one more added thing in the room. On the 2nd night the fan stopped working and they had no other fan. After much complaining they put us in a bigger room which was for a party of four. I am not sure why they did not do this from the beginning and we paid for 4people. The staff was not very friendly the coolest place was the lobby so we ended up spending our afternoons there if we were in the hotel and they did not like that at all. A/c not working was a complain from all the people that were staying there. We had stayed at best western triangoli which was excellent including the breakfast spread in the morning compared to that this hotel needs to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant walk to St Peter's Basilica”
Reviews.Author: bargebottom
Reviews.Content: From this hotel it is so easy to get to St. Peter's, Sant' Angelo, the Vatican Museum and the Tiber. I walked to the Piazza del Popolo. BUT...The first room I was placed in was literally the size of a closet. For ten Euros more I was moved to a larger (not large) room. As I was only staying two nights, it was tolerable. When I asked to have the A/C turned on (it was 80 degrees in the room), I was told that the hotel hadn't yet received approval to turn the air on (Rome is going GREEN). The room was relatively clean but the temp. at 2:00AM was still 78 degrees with the window open. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If I wanted to be near St. Peter's, I would still stay here again but I would ask more questions at check in to be sure the room was more comfortable. I'm told there were rooms with balconies, but I didn't see them. For Rome, the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: madmad1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at (again) Hotel Spring House in Rome for a week this past June and, once again, had a very pleasant stay. The hotel staff (everyone!) are so very accomodating and friendly. Paolo at the front desk was so kind and helpful in every way. Bennie who worked in the breakfast room and lounge was outstanding with his service, his smile and attending to our every need. Spring House has the BEST breakfast. They even have baby food if you have a baby! The children with us were delighted with the choices of breakfast cereals & fruit. Our rooms (2) were always clean and well kept. It's always a pleasure staying here. Ask for quiet rooms not facing the street. This is our 4th time. It's also very, very convenient to the Metro and just a block from the Vatican Museum and a quick 15 minute walk to St. Peters. I highly recommend Hotel Spring House.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: ttroy
Reviews.Content: We were in Italy for a wedding in a small town near Florence. We ended our trip in Rome and chose this hotel because of the positive reviews. When we arrived in our room, the air conditioner was barely functioning, the floor boards were coming up (they tried to hold them down with "hot glue", the remnants of which were very visible), the baseboards were coming off the wall; there was a hole in another wall that they tried to cover up with a plate, but the plate was cock-eyed over the hole and was not covering the hole. The leg of the bed was broke and the bathroom was filthy. When we complained, we were not treated kindly by some of the front desk staff. They said they brought in a technician to check the air and it was "fine"....NOT! They ultimately changed our room but we arrived in that room and it was not made up and the tub was filthy as the cleaning staff had not been in to clean the room. Once clean, the room was better than the first. They did not compensate us at all for the night they made us stay in the first room. The way we were treated by the front desk staff left us with such a bad taste in our mouths that we did not trust them to clean our room when we were out (we re-used our towels, went without emptying trash and had unmade beds for 3 days) nor did we ask them to make a cab reservation for us on the day we departed, as we thought they might intentionally sabotage us from making our scheduled flight. The ancillary staff were very pleasant and accomodating and the one positive about our stay there. The breakfast was also pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: beryl_10
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel if room rather small and appeared to be in the basement no natural light. Breakfast was great wonderfull selection waiting staff excellent. Cocktail/snack bar very disappointing very small no atmosphere. With one exception (an impatient lady) the reception staff were very helpfull and pleasant. Would stay there again cos I love Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, small bathrooms, good breakfast, good air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: isla-soleada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to boarding a Mediterranean cruise. Had one double room (tiny bathroom), one triple room and one family room. All were comfortable for European standards and, very important for us since it was very hot outside...the a/c worked fabulously! The personnel were very helpful - they provided us with transportation from the airport, transportation to the port of Civitavecchia the following day, suggestions for a nearby lunch, and sightseeing tips.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: traveleramanda
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly leading up to our stay there as we were concerned about a few things being 3 young girls traveling alone. They offer an airport pick up which was ideal for us because our flight got in late and this was our first real time in Europe and without English as a first language. Anyway I'm pretty sure it was the owner who picked us up and drove us back to the hotel for a fee but we thought it was reasonable, considering. They also offer free use of bikes which I would have enjoyed. A short (5 min or so) walk to the Vatican City walls and maybe 10 minute walk to the closest metro. Very nice inside, elevator very small but they have one! And the rooms were also nice. Slight mold problem in our room but we aren't living there so I didn't see it as a problem. Breakfast buffet--awesome! It was the best part about this place other than the staff who were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel,great people!”
Reviews.Author: Katrina-Rico
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. Our son was studying in Rome the second semester of his sophomore year in college. Being the good parents that we are (just to make sure he was ok),we decided that a trip to Italy was in order. When looking for a hotel near the Vatican (St John's Rome campus is close by), we came upon the Spring House. Romina and the staff were warm and gracious; they made us feel like family! We stayed the first three nights with them, then ventured off to Venice and Florence and ended our stay in Italy with two more nights in Rome at the Spring House. Hoping that the coins we tossed into the Trevi Fountain will bring us back to Rome and our friends at the Spring House soon!

Reviews.Title: “Not what was advertised”
Reviews.Author: OkieTraveler73162
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and the hotel fact sheet, so we had high expectations. This hotel has lots of pros and cons. The pros: location near Vatican City, grocery store next door, restaurant in hotel and across the street, most of staff very friendly and manager responded to most issues, luggage storage available. The cons: air conditioning in regular rooms is very limited and has no individual thermostat, safe in the room was not securely attached to anything so someone could carry it away, guest laundry advertised but non-existent, extremely small shower stall in regular rooms, and when manager is gone the night shift not always very helpful. When we arrived after departing a cruise ship, the room was not ready. No surprise, but after waiting an hour and a half with a promise to expedite cleaning, the room still was not ready. We had laundry to do and time to do it before our afternoon tour, so we asked for the guest laundry. The desk attendant said they had no guest laundry (one is advertised in the hotel fact sheet). So, we left our luggage and our dirty laundry and went on with visiting Rome and our scheduled tour, returning to the hotel around 21:00. Arriving in the room that night, we found the room very muggy even though the fan did blow some air. It had been an above average temperature day for Rome, but we expected the room to cool down soon and thought perhaps the problem was the key card control had not allowed the air conditioner to run while the room was unoccupied (turned out to be a bad assumption). We were barely able to sleep, but weary from a long day, we eventually slept in our sweat. The shower the next morning required some acrobatics to squeeze into the tiny stall. When we mentioned our problems and disappointment to the manager, she moved us to a nice room with an individual thermostat and a larger toilet with nice tub/shower. I would recommend this hotel only if you stay in one of the rooms on the ground floor next to the bar/lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; staff made us feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: 154913Denise
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome! Spring House was a perfect hotel for us. The location was one street away from the Vatican walls. Area safe to walk around in evenings. A bit of a walk to other parts of Rome (Piazza Novona, Piazza di Spagna; about 35 min.) but metro (Cipro station) was very close to hotel. We used the metro a couple of times when we didn't want to walk any more. Back to hotel, room was cleaned daily. Bed very comfortable. A/C worked when needed. Free internet service. Shower in the bathroom was very small, but manageable once you got used to it. Our room was deluxe with a small balcony; nice to sit outside once in awhile. Ample room for hanging clothes in closet. Breakfast buffet was spectacular; both hot and cold items, bacon, eggs, cereals, fresh fruit salad, sweets). Many thanks to Riccardo, Benny and Tiziana who made our mornings more delightful! Reception staff very helpful and polite. We really liked the complimentary mini bar (replenished daily!) which was included in our rate. Elevator is somewhat slow and small in size, but I still used it, while my husband walked the stairs (his choice!). Some restaurant recommendations: Pasqualino near Colosseo, PizzaRe on Via di Ripetta (large variety of pizzas and specials) and Tre Pupazzi (near Spring House Hotel area). We chose this based on previous recommendations and were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: smile77056
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at this hotel on May 15 and 16. Received welcome cocktail on arrival. Free items include the following: bottle water in the refrigerator, internet with printer, bicycle and breakfast. Very clean and neat room. In fact, the hotel cleans your room twice a day. Cute decor with balcony. Good location for people who wanted to visit the Vatican. I forgot to mention to the hotel, it would be nicer if they have shower caddy in the shower. You can walk around the neighborhood to find food and retail stores. A small supermarket is located to the right hand side of the hotel but closed kinda early. I didn't use public transportation during my trip and so no comment on that. Overall, I would recommend it to others who are looking for a quiet and pleasant place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & Breakfast with Beny is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sayllr
Reviews.Content: Flew to Rome from Seattle a 24+hours trip. Arrived at the hotel & Beny, the hotel's restauranteur brought us coffee in the lobby as we made plans for the afternoon. That was a culture shock of the best kind & really revived us! We used the free guest computer to make reservations at the Vatican but got hung up on keys that didn't type the character we wanted. (Found that in all other hotels too.) The staff at the desk suggested we just walk over since it was only a 5 minutes from the hotel. My husband did that while I tried the computer. Finding there was no line, we walked over without reservations & got in right away & spent the rest of the day enjoying the sights.. Our room was fine, quiet, & large with a side view of the top of St Peter's. At breakfast, Beny ushered everyone in and was very personable & attentive to all the guests. We had a lot of fun trying out Italian- sounding words with him. Told him the breakfast selection was fabuloso. Turns out his English is far better than our Italian. The next morning, he even remembered how we took our coffee. The breakfast was hearty with bacon, ham, berry cheesecake, OJ & more...a true buffet to power you for a full day in Rome. Beny is bennisimo!! The Spring House met all our needs in fine fashion...even stored our luggage before & after our checkin & checkout. We'f definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Coming Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DavidandSandy
Reviews.Content: The service was exceptional - all of the staff (Benny, Tiziana, Riccardo, Paola, Anna, Maurizio) could not have been more helpful and their advice about the city was excellent. The breakfast service was first class and we even had help in getting my wife's broken glasses fixed! As our main interest was in the Vatican the location was excellent - only 100 yards to the start of the Vatican Tours. Although the air conditioning had yet to be turned on the room was fine, linen replaced every 2 days with fresh towels every day - also soft drinks in the minibar - the bed was one of the most comfortable we've slept in! Overall the best was the service, the least was the fact that air conditioning had yet to be turned on although the Romans probably didn't feel as warm as we Northeners did! If we were being desperately critical some fresh wallpaper would have given the rooms 5 stars rather than 4.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated hotel. Sights are fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: SOHEL5272
Reviews.Content: Given the positive reviews on this hotel, I have to say that I was disappointed. Our room was dusty and had ants in it! I mentioned this to reception who sent someone to fix this. However, this was an ongoing issue during our stay. In addtion, the room was very dusty and not properly cleaned. Again, I had to raise this with reception. No air conditioning upon our arrival. I was told that this was due to regulation. No one told me! Breakfast was ok and the staff that serve it are very good. Next door is a shop where you can buy water very cheap. A large bottle of water costs 20 euro cents. Tne same bottle will cost approximately 1 euro 80 cents from the nearest station! We used the station " Cipro De Vaticani". You can buy tickets from the station or the tobacco shop around the corner. However, the owners were so unwelcoming, after a couple of days, we just went to the station - get the tickets from the machine. VERY IMPORTANT - the hotel's nearest stations are on Line A. This line shuts at 9pm every day except Saturday. After this, you have take a bus replacement. This can severely delay your journey back to the hotel. Whatever you do, don't get of at the stop "SPAGNA". One night, our train broke down there, at about 08:30. We had to walk for miles to find the nearest bus stop. We should have been back at the hotel by 9pm. We got back around 11:15. We had our 4 year old with us. Not good! The hotel is very near to the Vatican. The queues to get in were massively long. To avoid this, we saw the Vatican via a guided tour. This is more expensive. However, you do avoid the queues. Getting on a tour is no problem. This is big business and there are many many tour guides who want your money! It cost 45 euro per adult, but is saves you a potentially 5 - 6 hour wait! I found the locals to be not very helpful. Crossing the road is very dangerous! Foodwise - Rome is not cheap. Eat the breakfast and lots of it! Good tip - for a fantastic cheap ice cream, go the "THE OLD BRIDGE" ice cream shop near the vatican. Very good. If you like Indian food, you have to go to the Vittoria or Terminin areas - good food there. Buy travelcard to get around. This will let you go on any form of public transport. Otherwise, be prepared to walk! There are not many tube stations! The main sights are fantastic - Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Vatican - all incredible. Rome is not a place to take your young children. If you do take them, treat them to a day at Villa Borghese park.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Fletcher_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 6 nights and absolutely loved it, there is nothing we could fault. The location is brilliant, about 5 minutes from the Vatican museum and the staff at the hotel are absolutely fabulous. The staff in the dining room; Benny, Riccardo and Titiana, were polite, efficient and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. They were pleased to provide me with soya milk to accompany the complimentary breakfast and my eldest daughter enjoyed the wheat free diet (which had been one of the reasons l booked this hotel). Housekeeping staff were thorough and quiet and worked to a high standard. The staff on the reception were welcoming, informative and never tried any hard selling. We appreciated the location and its proximity to the Vatican museum and enjoyed a fabulous guided tour of this magnificent place. Thanks to booking in advance we skipped the massive queues which were never less than 2.5 hours(except on Sunday when it was closed) and we have to sing the praises of the best tour guide ever. A Wiganer called Sister Emmanelle, part of one of the orders of nuns living in Rome, showed us through the museum,the Cistine Chapel and the Basilica. She was absolutely brilliant, very knowledgeable, incredibly enthusiastic and really funny. We had a fabulous time in Rome and we will definitely be returning to the same hotel. Fletcher family UK

Reviews.Title: “10 minute walk to the Vatican!”
Reviews.Author: LivingtheGoodLife3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and it was very pleasant. A few negative things: the one elevator was very small and very slow, considering there was 7 floors. The walls were very thin and we could hear everything our neighbors were saying. We did the front desk and they handled the situation and we did not have to move rooms. The rooms are VERY small. We had a cot in our room for our son and there was truly no room to move. The bathrooms were also very small and if you are a plus sized person, it is nearly impossible to get in and out of the shower stall because of the sliding doors. Positives: Reception couldn't have been nicer. Breakfast was plentiful and well tended. The location was great to get to the Vatican and not far from the Metro, maybe a 15-20 minute walk. The pizza/kebab place across the street was really surprisingly great. Very friendly Egyptian-run, clean, cheap and they had a brick oven for pizza. Parking below the hotel was 20E but they let us keep the car there late into the next day for no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inconnu1
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but very clean. Breakfast is good. Staff is pretty and willing to help. The hotel is quiet and well located (close to Vatican).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: 40718Sue
Reviews.Content: The room was pristine in regards to cleanliness. The location was really good for our first two days in Rome since it is so close to the Vatican and St. Peter's Square The beds were very comfortable. We stayed in a triple and found it very roomy for the three of us. The breakfast was very good - lots of choices and some hot items, and the service staff was excellent. The location was not close to the heart of the city near the Coliseum and Pantheon, but the subway is easily accessible. We would definitely go back to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel near the vatican”
Reviews.Author: KRIS10L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Spring House for four nights and couldn't be happier with our choice. We were upgraded to a loft room which had plenty of space. The bathroom was huge. The bed was very soft (newer mattresses), which we didn't expect to find in Italy. The hotel is very new looking and I believe they are still doing some renovations. The Vatican Museum is literally a block away and St. Peter's square is within walking distance. All the staff members speak English. The best part is their breakfast which had eggs, bacon, fruit and amazing pastries. Be sure to try a chocolate croissant. They also have a bar/restaurant that is open until 11:30pm. If you have young children, don't go for the loft style room. The bannister along the loft and stairs is very open.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel with kind staff”
Reviews.Author: csocs
Reviews.Content: I scanned the hotels for hours to find a reasonable but nice place to stay in Rome. When I saw the fashion room of the Spring House I immediatelly knew this is what I'm looking for! I also read through the tripadvisor reviews and I it seemed evereything should be fine except for the size of the bath and the thinness of the wall. The fashion room eliminated both weekness: separated place plus huge bath! The rest of the things provided the expected quality: nice, smiling and helpful staff, extending room, free minibar with beer, mineral water, soft drink, small bottle of champaign, free room service etc. Summary, I found the perfect place for our expectations and I can only advice to anyone with the note that you should not avoid the extra fee of the fashion room! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A Return to a Great Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KeithGHullEngland
Reviews.Content: This must be the friendliest hotel in Rome. This is my second visit herte and as before everthing is spot on. Briliant breakfast sets you up for the day exploring Rome. All staff are friendly efficient and courtius. Some rooms slightly small but when compared to US rooms are quite large. Location is great for the Vatican but slightly out for other Rome attractions. Nearby Metro aliviates that problem though. To some up a great hotel which i hope to return to again on my next Rome visit. Choose and you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, good location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MPHBomo
Reviews.Content: Having researched for days on where to stay on my first visit to Rome it became apparent that it was going to be hard to find a place that ticked all the boxes of reasonable price, cleanliness and location. The Hotel Spring House achieved all this and is a great place to stay. The staff were very friendly and polite, the hotel was in very good order and the room was fantastic for the money. We were pleasantly surprised to be on the top floor with a balcony over looking the walls of the Vatican city which was far from our expectations considering the trend of very small hotel rooms across the city. I appreciate that location needs differ for everyone so I will summarise the keys points which suited us. The hotel is 15 minutes from central termini station by tube (by far the best way to get around, safe and cheap, 4 EUR for the day). The area surrounding is quieter than the main tourist streets of Rome though there are several local restaurants that the locals use which is a very good sign of quality in my eyes. Hotel is on the north wall of the Vatican City which if you are visiting Rome is sure to be on your list of places to visit. As the queues to get in can be ridiculous it makes sense to head over as early as possible after breakfast to beat the rush which makes location ideal. The only con I would say was the hotel restaurant served average food but with so much choice in surrounding streets I don’t think this is a big deal. Hotel breakfast was however fantastic with a great selection to set you up for a day of sight seeing. All in all a great hotel which helped make the trip to Rome even better than expected – would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A happy well traveled family”
Reviews.Author: MomBrockton
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the advise of our Travel Agent and were glad we did. The hotel is just off the beaten path which makes it more relaxing getting there and quieter for our family. The easy access to the Vatican and Metro was great. Right next to the hotel ia a small grocery store so we could pick up snacks.There is also a great restaurant and gelato store around the corner. The people that ran the hotel were wonderful. There was nothing to big or small that they couldn't do or answer for us. We had breakfast downstairs every morning. The pastries were excellent and the choices were great. We would go back and stay at the Spring House Hotel on another trip to Rome. The convenience to every thing was perfect. They can also have a car pick you up at the Airport. It was more convenient and cheaper than a cab.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Getawayguy20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic - at the end of a quiet dead end street, we even had a balcony. Breakfast was great too, even our younger girls enjoyed it. Room was more spacious that what you normally get in Rome, and the proximity to the Vatican was good. You're surrounded by more of a neighborhood with cool shops and restaurants - we even ate at a pizza restaurant where they let our girls come back into the kitchen to watch their pizzas being made. Loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: IrelandHerbie
Reviews.Content: just back from a 3 night stay at this Hotel. Well first when we arrived there was confusion i booked a triple room and when we got to room it had only one double bed, We contacted reception and the girl on wanted us to take a delux room at 56 per person extra per night, this was very unfair, it was only when another man who works there intervened and we were shown a room with a double bed and a pull out one which we accepted, did not need this hassle after a long day, rooms are small i especially asked for a large room as there were 3 of us. to sum it up the hotel is very clean staff are very helpful apart from the girl at reception, its very near the Vatican and V Museum, so really enjoyed walking around , I would recommend this Hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great service, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: IttyBittyLydi
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at this hotel!! It made it so convenient for us on our tours!! It's in the perfect spot!! Plus, the service was great! Especially if you go see Benny downstairs at the bar!! We still keep in touch!!! He is awesome!!! Everyone, you must go see him! The rooms were pretty spacious, more than I thought they'd be anyway. All in all, a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great location, and GREAT value for the budget-minded traveler!!!”
Reviews.Author: RomeInJanuary
Reviews.Content: We never stay at Best Western Hotels...so we were a little nervous about staying at one in Italy. However, we were on a tight budget, so we decided to take the chance. It was well worth every Euro! The staff was great! The full breakfast was delicious! The hotel has a little restaurant/bar that has awesome pizza and pretty good wine. The location was perfect for seeing the Vatican and getting to other sites was easy. We opted to walk most places versus braving the Metro. It's a good thing we did walk to burn off the calories from pasta and pastries! The rooms are small, but tidy. Our toilet had a problem (it ran a lot!). But the staff were very accommodating. Truly, we can highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome without unlimited funds. We'll be returning to Rome and we'll most definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier!”
Reviews.Author: holy1957
Reviews.Content: BW Spring House was a great place for our family to home base. Walking distance to Vatican and just a few blocks to the Metro. Market next door and bigger one just a block and a half away. Staff was always helpful with anything we asked. Breakfast exceeded our expectation. Would definately stay here again -

Reviews.Title: “Great location, right at the bottom of the stairs to the vatican museum”
Reviews.Author: mauitraveler2007
Reviews.Content: This was a great location. Very close to the Vatican/St Peters. Neighborhood seemed a little scarey - but ended up being fine. Room was small, but clean. A little noisy. Breakfast was good. Bennie (the breakfast waiter) was great - the morning he wasnt there was chaos. This was close to the subway. Internet in the room was pretty spotty. I think that the hotel was a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: eipamay
Reviews.Content: We live in Naples, Italy and have traveled to Rome quite a bit. This was our first time staying at the Best Western and we have decided that this is the only place we will stay in Rome in the future. They had rooms that accommodated 4 people, which is sometimes hard to find in Europe. They also have their own garage, which is also hard to find in big cities in Europe. The hotel was located within walking distance of the Vatican, which is where we were headed for Christmas Eve mass. There were plenty of restaurants in the local area. The breakfast was good and Benny the waiter was very friendly. They also have a cocktail hour from 4-6p.m. and Sergio the bartender was very nice. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: giuditta0
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Best Western Hotel Spring House in Rome was consistently friendly and helpful in providing information on nearby restaurants, directions to destinations nearby and further afield in Italy, and thankfully help for a relative who was ill during our visit. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Vatican, shopping and restaurants for every pocketbook. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay in Best Western when traveling to Europe”
Reviews.Author: herleiness
Reviews.Content: This hotel convinced us to stay in Best Western when travelling to Europe from now on. First, they can speak some English, room is clean,breakfast is good, location is on the spot and staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Room and Location PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Sawlaws
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the room and location. Two metro stattions within only about 4 blocks. pleanty of shopping and restaurants around. Loved that it was located near vatican and not the center of Rome, I think it was safer and more quiet at night because of this. The metro was incredibly easy to navigate, more so than NYC. The staff was nice and helpful, I happened to have left a personal item on the bed underneath the sheets and when the sheets were changed it went to the laundry room. The staff allowed my husband to search the laundry bags and he eventually found the item. We only had two minor issues with our experience, 1) I sent 2 e-mails to the hotel requesting early check in, one was sent 2 weeks before leaving and than another 4 days prior to leaving. I did not get a response back from the hotel either times. This was very surprising and unfortunately they could not accomodate an early check that day. They did allow us to have access to the free breakfast that mornign to make it up. I though this was a wonderful gesture, but would have perferred getting into my room earlier. Issue 2) We are struggling with Best Western to have the points earned during our stay applied to our rewards account. We did an automatice check out and did not receive a paper receipt verifying payment of our stay. When we notified Best western of our missing points they explained they would need us to fax or mail to them a copy of the receipt verifying payment for our stay. So now I have sent an e-mail to the hotel hoping they can comply with our request for an electronic receipt verifying payment to earn the rewards point. I am hoping the e-mail sent requesting this does not go unseen. Overall, we would stay againa nd recommend this to any one wanting to stay just outside of the city center. A great liitle restaurant called Piacere Molise is right down the street and has great food. Small, cozy, and accomodating. A store is right next door to the hotel, which was great to stock up for things in the room. The breakfast was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: fossie35
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room for three nights in October 2010. The room was on the 7th floor(Top)but the lift only went to the 6th and you had to walk one flight of stairs-this was no problem for us.The room was huge with a kingsize bed and a large double sofabed.On one side was a window that if you opened and looked to the left you had a clear view of the dome of St Peters.On the other side was a door to a small terrace with sunlounger and a table and 2 chairs from which there was a view of the buildings of the Vatican Museum and and across the rooftops of the city to the distant hills.The bathroom was a great size with a shower cubicle and a corner jaccuzi bath which was wonderful at the end of the day. A cab from the airport cost €40.We used the # 492 bus from the top of the road to get to city centre, or it was a 5 minute walk to Cipro metro station. We took a cab from outside the metro back to the airport again for €40 as we were only travelling with hand luggage. Each morning the queues for the Vatican Museum were huge but by 1.30pm on the Tuesday the line was non existent.We walked straight in although some parts of the museum were really crowded other galleries it was just us and the security guards. Hotel breakfast was plentiful and internet service was good.We were able to print out our Boarding cards.All of the staff were friendly and spoke excellent English. The location suited us a we did not require a lively nightlife.We felt safe walking in the neighbourhood during day and at night.The little supermarket next door was handy . Overall it was a very enjoyable stay in a well situated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: inthemidnighthour
Reviews.Content: had an excellent 5 night stay here with my wife and 2 teenage sons.we booked a family room which was basically 2 doubles each with bathroom with an interconnecting door.our room was a good size with balcony and the boys ok but smaller with no balcony. looking at the floorplan whilst waiting for the lift some of the rooms did seem small . the cleanliness and the friendliness of the staff where all excellent. location was also good 2 metro stations 5 mins away and vatican city only 1 minute away, which was handy as the queues for the vatican museum (sistine chapel) were the longest ever ,so we were up early and joined 45 mins before it opened and entered just after opening there was also a small supermarket adjacent to the hotel for snacks etc

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: politebat
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to rome..and the springhouse was a great first place. Yes the rooms and bathrooms and lift are tiny, as is most of europe. That being said...the room was spotless...the breakfast was hot, and pretty good, the internet was free (most places charge at least 15 euro) and the front desk was helpful and very nice. Its right next to the vatican and a lot of local food places...who have really good prices. I like this hotel, and I will go back next time I'm in rome. Oh the metro was one block over...great place.

Reviews.Title: “Was I Just Unlucky?”
Reviews.Author: docscooter
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews and a recommendation from a work collegue. The hotel was OK but I was somewhat underwhelmed and disappointed. This makes me think that maybe I was just unlucky. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, good start, and having a quick look around the hotel everything looked good. I went to my room and this is where my problem lies. The single room was tiny, I could put my arms out and touch both walls quite easily. The bed was small and the headboard was basically a cuboard pushed against the bed. When I sat up to read it was unable to cope with this and started to slide across the room. The airconditioning was noisy and failed to get the room cool and there are no controls for to change it. Due to the noise from the other rooms and air con, a small bed and a hot room I had a terrible nights sleep. To be fair the room and bathroom were clean and smart. I felt the 110 euro charge for this room was excessive. Breakfast offered a cold buffet which was OK but I had to keep asking for a hot drink which eventually came as I had finished breakfast and I was ready to leave. As a business traveller my priorities are the bedroom quality, sleep quality and breakfast. Had the bedroom been much better I coudl imagine giving this a a much better rating.

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recomment this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NapoliNina
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location for visiting the Vatican Museums, and it offered comfort, a high standard of cleanliness, excellent and plentiful breakfast and very accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home in the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: Isabella15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Spring House earlier this month on a celebratory trip to Italy (we're having a baby!). Rome was our singular destination and we spent a total of 8 days at the hotel, so we're in a particularly informed position to comment. I have nothing but great things to say about the Best Western Spring House - clean and comfortable rooms, daily hot American breakfast (included free!), reasonable rates, very close proximity to the Vatican, a metro stop and all manner of buses linking the city - but what really sets this hotel apart is the warm professionalism and hospitality of the staff. Their English was impeccable, they were more than happy to share their knowledge of/recommendations for the city and one could really sense the care they imparted upon their guests and the quality of their stay. Our favorite was the manager Daniel who warmly greeted us upon our arrival and felt like a friend throughout our visit. When booking the reservation online we mentioned that the trip was a celebration of our impending parenthood. When we arrived in the room, there was lovely fruit basket and congratulatory note with a stork awaiting us on the desk. What a kind and memorable gesture, we still have the note and feel like that small act set the tone for our entire stay. And of course it made this last "hurrah" before our little one arrives that much more precious. In summary, if you're looking for a great home away from home during your visit to Rome, look no further than the Best Western Spring House Hotel - I enthusiastically recommend it to all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: herzen
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the best western spring house, and I would recommend it anytime pros: the room, although a bit small, is comfortable and features all necessary features and is quiet. From the sixth floor, the view was not bat at all, highlighting the St-Peter's dome and Vatican walls. Also, great breakfast, wonderful service (maids and reception), no unpleasant surprises and just by a very pleasant district, full of stores, restaurants, cafes close to two metro stations,... (also, grocery store is 10 meters away from entrance of hotel!) Cons: Not many at all. Air conditioning fine, but not the greatest (quite normal by italian standards though, as it worked better then friends in other hotels). Restroom could use some improvement ( the shower especially). great choice in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent”
Reviews.Author: ste1103a
Reviews.Content: The Spring House has an excellent location. We walked nearly everywhere, including the Forum from here but we are walkers. The Cipro Metro Station is quite close and the Vatican is a short walk. There are many good and inexpensive cafes close. The hotel is clean and has an excellent breakfast. The rooms are small but not excessively so.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, with added benefit of balcony and light room”
Reviews.Author: Thehalls_15
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 172 and were very pleased. It was a lovely light room, with an added benefit of a balcony. We had a whirlpool bath, which was great after a long day sightseeing! I would say the location wasn't the most ideal, as it was a bit of a walk everyday to get near the open top buses. However, as long as you dont mind a walk it was bearable. Breakfast was great, enough variety for everyone. There is a mini supermarket 2 doors down - so you can top up with snacks and drinks really reasonably. We stayed in August for 4 days. Plenty of time for sightseeing, but enough time to relax. Definitely go on the open top buses as this gives you a chance to see all the areas - it would have been too hot to walk everywhere. We booked the buses before we went, however I would say you would get a much better deal to book when you get there - we managed to knock down the price - dont forget you can also extend your ticket for a few euro's more, (we didnt realise this and paid again for another 24 hours). A guided tour of the Vatican and Sistine Chapel was really great....one of the highlights of the trip, (we booked this prior to the trip, but plenty of chances when you get there). A fantastic time - especially as the hotel was so good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel which is closely located near the Vatican. The hotel is in a quiet area of Rome so ideal for families. The breakfast is varied and has enough choice for even fussy eaters. The staff are friendly. The accomodation is clean and well presented. The only downside of the hotel is the shower. Strange spa shower which is very small (I'm not that big, but felt uncomfortable!) and difficult to use. Walls are also a bit thin. I had a room with an ajoining door and felt the other family were actually in my room when they opened some crisps!! Didn't put me off though.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: JH1027
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel in late June. I can only echo what so many other reviewers have said. Great location, convenient to Metro and Vatican. Impeccably clean. Great breakfast buffet with a large selection of choices. Helpful, friendly staff. Free wi-fi that worked fine for us. I've seen a lot of comments about the rooms being small, but I found ours to be perfectly adequate. It was not huge, but we never felt cramped either. We went out walking every night. We always felt safe and we found a number of restaurants nearby. We also were regulars at the Old Bridge gelato stand which you pass on the way to the Vatican. (Locals were lined out the door every time we walked by, so that can only mean good things!) Bottom line, this hotel exceeded my expectations and I would not hesitate to book there again if I am ever fortunate enough to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service, good location, yummy breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: BonnieKa
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my sister to Rome and we stayed at the Best Western Spring Hotel. It is located close to the Vatican Museum and accessible from the Cipro subway stop. We felt safe walking in the neighborhood to/from the subway, even at midnight. Don't miss out on the Millenium Gelato located near the hotel.
