You'll see the locals there every night (even past midnight)....good gelato! The hotel was clean, all staff members were very polite and helpful. Our room and bathroom was small, but always clean(ed). Beds are firm. Air conditioned, but don't expect any air conditioning to be frigid like in the US while in Rome. Breakfast was the same each morning, but delicious (fruits, veggies, eggs, meat....hot and cold, cereal, sweets/breads, yogurt, coffee). Breakfast 7-10:30. We were happy to find a laptop for our use near the lobby (free usage). There is an "American Bar" with snacks/drinks in the hotel, but we did not use it as we were gone all day, everyday. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel. Not a lot of restaurants nearby, but close to the subway for easy take-off (around 3 city blocks away). Initially we wanted to stay here to use the bikes they had available, but after being in the city a day, we decided NOT to attempt biking with the crazy Rome traffic. However, they are there if you want them......also, we could not fit a bike ride into our schedule.....too many other wonderful things to do in Rome! The hotel is about a 5-8 minute walk to the Vatican Museum and about 15 minutes from St. Peter's Basilica. This is close walk in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I spent 3 nights at the...”
Reviews.Author: Mnreiter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Spring House. We had a great time and the location was good... Right around the corner from the Vatican museum and the metro station. The hotel staff was great and spoke pretty good English. The breakfast was also nice in the mornings before we headed out. The rooms are small but that is to be expected in Italy. It was clean and overall a very nice hotel. We would definitely stay at the Spring House again. The only thing I can say that is not completely positive is that the walls are thin and sometimes you can hear your neighbors. Other than that, we were very happy with our choice of staying here. A previous guest lists instructions on how to get to the hotel from the airport and they were VERY helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and close to Metro and the Vatican and 10 min by subway to heart of Rome...helpful staff great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: liquidsodium
Reviews.Content: Had booked in advance and paid...so no hassles as we arrived. Courteous staff. They had the Roma pass so we purchased from them (cash only). There is an elevator and we stayed on the 3rd floor....no real rooms with view. It is on a small street and there are a few restaurants close-by. Metro(subway) is incredibly close and very convenient to use once you get the Roma pass. Spanish Steps Metro station is 3 stations down and only 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: quixote43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May and were very pleased with the hotel and our room. And it was the best breakfast we had during the 3 weeks were in Italy! It was very close to the Vatican and the area had a nice, neighbourhood feel to it since it wasn't overrun with other tourists. The room was on the small side, and some of the wallpaper was starting to peel and needed updating, but it was clean and comfortable. We would have no hesitation in staying here again if we are ever fortunate enough to get back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the centre of Rome near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: rgtravels
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the centre of Rome near Vatican this is a good choice. The rooms are not very large but that’s because this is a small hotel. The bathrooms are tiny and made functional by some very thoughtful space design. Otherwise the rooms are comfortable for spending the night. I don’t know how convenient it would be by subway since the nearest station is about 10 minutes walk and has a long flight of stairs. We had asked for an airport pickup. Surrounding area is great and you get a real feel of Rome. Convenient eating places all around and a good convenience store adjoining the hotel. Had difficulty with using the net on my laptop but the hotel PC worked fine and was free. Breakfast was not a kings spread but more than adequate with scrambled eggs, fruits, cereal, muffins etc. Great for a start to the day. Staff and especially Paulo at the front end was very good and helpful. English speaking!! Was really helpful in advising us on what to do and how to get everywhere. I think that if you are there for sightseeing and need a great clean place to spend the night with all conveniences and proximity to the Vatican then you can safely book here and you will be pleased. Especially with the great smiling people running the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like this place, but...”
Reviews.Author: johnmflores
Reviews.Content: We traveled last summer with family to get married in Italy. We picked the Best Western Spring House in Rome for a number of reasons - the location close to the Vatican was nice, they offered wheelchair accessibility (for my father), we wanted a US hotel whose reputation we could trust, and the price was right. When we got there, the hotel had a lot going for it - the staff was cordial, the rooms clean, and the beds firm. It wasn't luxury accommodations by any means, but when you are on a budget, clean counts for a lot. The place also had a touch of modern style and the little bar served good food for weary travelers. The elevator broke down while we were there, but they had someone working on it immediately. We've traveled enough to know that things like this happen in old cities though, and don't really count that against them. Our biggest disappointment with the hotel is the security of the lobby. When we arrived, we were tired and hungry but had to wait for our rooms. OK. The staff invited us to the bar for a complimentary drink. They said to leave our bags (many of them including wedding dresses) in the lobby. We weren't in the bar more than 5 minutes when my fiancee went back to the lobby to check on the bags. Much to her surprise, a bag was stolen. We later went to managers office to view it on the security camera and confirmed that two people worked together to steal the bag. The staff was very apologetic about the incident and promised that their insurance would take care of it, but nearly a year later and the issue is not resolved. Were it not for this lapse of security, I would recommend this hotel for people on a budget looking for simple clean accommodations. As it stands, we must caution everyone considering staying here. Yes, Rome, can be a big bad city, and tourist areas are rife with pick pockets and petty thieves. But one thing we absolutely expect of any hotel is that they stop the riff raff at their door. Sadly, Best Western Spring House failed.

Reviews.Title: “Three times there, would come again.”
Reviews.Author: MaryEvergreen
Reviews.Content: I Have stayed here in Spring 2008, 2009, 2010. Round the clock staff can not do enough for you, and to speak English. Whatever the problem - plumbing, TVs, computers, even needing to can opener! - The staff will solve your problem quickly. Rooms are very small by North American standards - get used to it! - But fully equipped with bathroom, air conditioning, fridge, cable TV. Bedding is not changed daily (who cares?) But bathroom is inside thoroughly cleaned daily. You can use WI-FI, or a communal computer near the entrance. Location is terrific, very near the Vatican Museum, a couple of blocks from subway Cyprus, close to good shopping and restaurants for all budgets. The daily breakfast buffet is a great, and gracious staff Throughout the hotel. Springhouse Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EdwinLO
Reviews.Content: This smallish hotel is a gem. It's really convenienient to get to the Vatican Museum & Cipro metro just a couple of hundred metres away; if you need snacks, or drinks there is a supermart directly next door that opens till 2030 most days; there is a Mexican restaurant directly opposite as well as a take away pizzeria. Turn left and then left again out of the hotel & there is an excellent Italian restaurant La Rustichella barely 3 minutes away with reasonable prices. The pasta & fish are great here. The staff are polite & try always to help & the breakfast is more than adequate with scrambled eggs, sausages, various breads & croissants, bacon, cheese & cold meat, 3 different juices, hot chocolate, cereals & yoghurt, and fresh strawberries, melon & various other fruit daily. Just stayed here for 7 nights in a triple room 120 that was comfortable, and clean. Shwer stall is a little small but toiletries & coffee/tea in room provided. All in all an excellent choice if you want to be near St Peters!!

Reviews.Title: “The only place I will stay when I go back to Rome is here”
Reviews.Author: Americanomadrid
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review to HELP people, as I feel that sometimes the reviews are not accurate on Tripadvisor. Let me explain. I went to Rome twice this year and the difference in hotels was night and day. Both had good reviews. First the positove: This is a GREAT hotel, clean, nice and friendly staff, a welcome drink if you want it, modern bathroom, good bed, balcony (in my room), CHEAP room service, free water in the mini bar, in room coffee and tea (a rarity in Europe), modern room, parquet floor, great breakfast dowstairs (quality choices) or a free continental breakfast served to your room, your choice, it smelled nice and I was happy and I am NOT EASY to please. The BAD hotel was NOVA DOMUS SUITES. What a piece of crap! Arrogant staff, dirty stinky rooms, disgusting breakfast (well, read my review because I slammed that place). The truth is all Roman hotels are overpriced, but I think that for the little extra for the Springhouse was worth it. The Driver picked us up at the airport (it was night) and it was a new Mercedes. Although a taxi may have been cheaper you risk getting ripped off. I went back via the express train. Everyone at this hotel is nice and the only bad I can say is that the shower stall is small. But the hot water is plentiful and constant temp. I really recommend this place and they deserve to be full for all their efforts. I hope they keep it up. BTW, they are extrememly close to the Vatican Museum. And DO TRY OLDBRIDGE Gelati when you are there. It is near the museum.

Reviews.Title: “In the Vatican's backyard”
Reviews.Author: mjane1999
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights before taking a cruise. It was in a great location just a few blocks from the Vatican. But the room was not very comfortable. It was also very small. And beware there is no air conditioning. So be careful when booking in Europe. I knew this and forgot to look at this particular hotel. Some of the Best Western's in Rome do have it and my mistake for not double checking on this one. Thank goodness it was in November that we were there and not in the summer. But we still had to open the windows when we slept. The shower was so small my 5 foot 2 in body could barely get out. And you could not turn around in it either. It was actually smaller than a small cruise ship shower! Then it was raised on a platform and when you got out it was quite a big step down and if you were not careful you would step right into the bidet. Yes there was a bidet . The restaurant was also not the norm as the dining room was also the bar. The bartender was also the cook. Who cooked your food to order per item on a hotplate behind the bar. Needless to say our food did not come out all at the same time. It came out one dish at a time. It wasn't bad but it was just a really odd experience. We didn't want to eat at the hotel but we were so tired after flying in on a 9 hour flight that morning and going straight to see the Colosseum. So we were wiped out and could barely even get back to the hotel. So we ate there on our way up to our room. Our first meal in Rome at happened at the strange Best Western. If you are used to small rooms without air conditioning then this hotel is for you.The only good thing about it was it being so close to the Vatican. You could walk up to the end of the street and see the back wall to the Vatican. It was very convenient for us in that respect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and area”
Reviews.Author: wfracchia
Reviews.Content: I wanted to add my 2cents to this great little hotel in Rome. We were there for 2 nights after a Med cruise and the Vatican was our most important stop so we chose this hotel for our stay. The location was wonderful and rooms and bed comfortable. Being Americans we wanted a good American style breakfast included in the price and the free internet was a BIG possitive as well. (even though you know you pay for it in your room rate) The grocery store next to the hotel was also nice to have. We would for sure stay here again on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, close to the Vatican and the metro, Cipro”
Reviews.Author: opatt
Reviews.Content: We spent two week in Italy and stayed at different hotels. By far this was one of the best. It was close to the Vatican and the metro station. It was not in the center, but it was a quiet and very clean hotel and the Metro was very easy to get to. Would not have stayed anywhere else. The staff was wonderful. Hernan, the doorman, was great. The front desk was very helpful with directions and any concerns we had were immediately addressed All our needs were met by ALL the staff. Breakfast was wonderful. We will definitely stay there again when we go back next year. Thanks to all the members of this hotel for making our first trip to Rome a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelinManTexas
Reviews.Content: I'm going to mention some items that I wanted to know before my trip... 1. Getting from FCO airport to the hotel by train: When you exit Customs at FCO, just follow the train signs until you get to the train stop at the airport. The cost to get from FCO to Termini station (the main station in Rome) was 14 Euros per person. Just walk up to the ticket counter and ask for a ticket to Termini. The train from FCO to Termini is called the Leonardo Express. It takes about 30 minutes to get from FCO to Termini. When you arrive at Termini station, follow the "M" signs for the Metro until you get to the Metro station. When you get to the Metro station, you can buy your ticket at one of the self-service kiosk. There is an option to have instructions in English. You can buy a 76-minute ticket for only 1 Euro to get you to Cipro station on Line A (take the Metro going to Battistini). We bought a 3 day pass for 11 Euros. This was the 3rd option. It takes about 10 minutes to get from Termini to Cipro station. When arriving at Cipro station, take the exit that has the "Musei Vaticani" sign. After you walk up the stairs, take a right. Then take an immediate right (this will put you on Via Candia). Stay on Via Candia until you reach Via Mocenigo. Take a right on Via Mocenigo. You will see the hotel at this point. It takes about 5-7 minutes to walk from Cipro to the hotel. 2. The hotel itself The hotel staff is great and helpful. Every staff member took the time to answer all of our questions. Paolo was especially helpful in the evenings for us. The room was very clean and looked new. But it was very small. I was in room 113 (1st floor over looking the entrance) and my mother was in room 133 (3rd floor over looking the entrance). I called the Best Western reservations number in the beginning of March and got a rate of 108 Euros per night with the Long Stay Promotion for 3 nights and my mother got the European Seniors rate of 108 Euros per night as well. Both rooms are single rooms. My room had about 2 feet of walking room from the bed to the wall and my mother's room had about 3 feet of walking room. The entrance to the shower stall is about 2 feet and the shower itself is about 2.5 feet by 2.5 feet. It was very small but there was plenty of hot water. The hotel has a computer close to the lobby to get on the Internet. This was very important to me to check flights and not have to find an Internet Cafe. The breakfast from 7am to 10am is excellent. The scrambled eggs were great. I was not expecting scrambled eggs. Also, the waiter at breakfast was very helpful in providing us with directions to the Appian Way. I would definitely stay at this hotel again even though the room is small. I really didn't care that much since all that I do in the room is sleep and shower. The walls are thin so I used ear plugs every night and slept fine. 3. Proximity to the Vatican Museum (this is where the Sistine Chapel is) The hotel is extremely close to the Vatican Musuem. Walk out of the hotel and take a right. Walk to the wall and follow it til you reach the first set of steps. When you walk up the steps, you see the entrance to the Vatican Museum. It takes literally about 2-3 minutes from the hotel 4. Subway system The subway system is excellent. It is very easy to use and the subways come so often that you don't wait long at all for them. 5. Getting from the hotel back to FCO airport You can buy your train ticket from Termini to FCO at the booth at the Termini station. You don't need to have a ticket before hand. It normally leaves from track 25. It costs 14 Euros per person to get from Termini to FCO. We flew on Continental Airlines which leaves from T5. So once we exited the train at FCO, we walked downstairs and had to take a shuttle bus to T5. Once you get to T5 to check-in, you have to take another shuttle to your gate. I say this because we didn't plan for these little extra things which take up time.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: moleyLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, things went well. The staff were very helpful and friendly, they enjoyed working there. Would recommend for anyone wanting to stay at a good value for money hotel in a central location. The only small thing that could be improved is the room service menu - I got back at 10pm one night to be told no hot fresh food was available. Other hotels do this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom35805
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days. On check in the staff went well out of their way to help us get to know area, made excellent recommendations for nearby non-touristy restaurants and throughout our stay the worked very hard make all the guests happy. Our room was small, but more than adequate and had a lovely balcony with chairs and a table for us. The room was clean and quiet, and the breakfast was great. The only shortcoming is that it is not as convenient to the Vatican as it looks on a map. Entrance to the Vatican Museum is, indeed, near the hotel, but since the Vatican is walled, to actually get to anything else it is quite a hike. Also, the short block the hotel is was quite littered, unlike the rest of Rome. However, the pros outweighed the cons and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Dloots
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. My teenage son and I stayed here for 5 nights. The included breakfast was wonderful. We loved the chocolate crossaints and cappuccinos. The location couldn't be better for visiting the Vatican and a metro stop was close to reach other Rome attractions. Around the hotel were many local restaurants that were delightful. As in all of Europe, the rooms are smaller than US hotels but we were very comfortable and the hotel was very clean. Beds are a little hard but again no different than many European hotels. Location, cost and ammenities of this hotel far outweigh these minor drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't find a fault”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelling84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Hotel Spring House for three nights and I have to say I could not find a fault with the hotel. We stayed in a summer room with breakfast included. The rate was excellent. Upon booking we also booked a transfer provided by the hotel. This was at a cost of €55 to be paid to the driver on arrival at the hotel. On arrival at the airport our driver was waiting there as planned. Check-in was quick and we were offered help, should we want it with our luggage. Our room was lovely. It wasn't huge but it wasn't tiny either. There was a lovely balcony. The free basket of fruit was also a nice touch. Bathroom was smallish but very clean. The room was spotless and was cleaned thoroughly everyday. The breakfast room is small but the turn around is very quick. There was a great selection of cereal, cold meats, fruits, youghurts, drinks etc The location is about a 10 minute walk away from St Peter's Basicilia and the entrance to the Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel is even closer. We checked out early on the morning of our departure and our bags were held for us at the hotel. Again on departure our driver was there ahead of time which meant that we didn't have to worry about getting to the airport on time. Also the Internet was free and I believe is free to all guests for the first 4 days of their stay. The next time I take a trip to Rome I will stay at this hotel and I will have no hesitation in recommending it to friends

Reviews.Title: “Compact, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kevvykogs
Reviews.Content: The Hotel room was Compact but fine as you are only in it for a couple of hours adn whilst sleeping. The Hotel is ideally situated for VATICAN and Sistine Chapel being only 2 minutes walk from the entrance. We walked to all other attractions, as we wanted to see as much as we could, however METRO station is only a 5 minute walk from Hotel and easy to find. Staff are really friendly and effiecient, breakfast was huge and great selection;Yoghurt and fruit, cereal, scambled eggs and Bacon, toast, breads, meat, pastires etc. Only dowside for us was room had a door to adjoining room and we ol hear thngs we didn't want to! Jut emal staff and checwhen you book. Hotel answered my email within 12 hours and offered to arrange airport pickup for same priceasTaxi. we used airpor shuttle minibus at 16 euros each as we arrvedlate at night; highly recommended. Return journey was Metro and train which was easy and cheaper when yuo have tim during the day.Restaurant recommed other sites for this Hotel was fantasic mealand atmosphere; authentic Italian. Small suprmarket 2 doors down from Hotel really useful as was Free WIFI. Good 3 star

Reviews.Title: “A great find at a great price”
Reviews.Author: UKEuropa
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome at the end of February for three nights and, given that I was travelling alone, wanted to be sure that I stayed somewhere where I felt safe, but stayed central and within my budget. This hotel was perfect, as I wanted to be right away from the noise and bustle of Termini, whilst still being close to everything. The proximity of the hotel to the Vatican Musueums cannot be emphasised enough - it is 2 minutes away. This in itself is enough of a selling point. However, I did struggle to find the hotel when I arrived at Ottaviano Metro station, but this was partly my fault as I arrived later than planned and misread the map. There are about 3 different ways you can access the hotel from the Metro station, but once you have figured this out, it is about a ten minute walk (and that is if you walk really slowly), and in a straight line. Roman streets tend to be quite long, and intersect each other more than once, and this did make getting bearings tricky. My room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable. The shower was also good, and there was always hot water. There were complimentary toiletries, tea and coffee making facilities, as well as a desk, a safe and mirrored wardrobe with plenty of hangers. The decor was very modern - wooden floors - but the room was still cosy. The TV had BBC World and CNN as well as French and Spanish channels. The room did get a little hot at night, but the window could be opened which was good as in some hotels you can't open the windows! The breakfast buffet was fantastic and definitely worth the price. You could have a healthy breakfast or a not so healthy one, the choice was yours - muesli, cereal, loads of types of bread, toast, jam, bacon, sausages, scrambled eggs, croissants, tarts, yogurt, fruit, cold meat, cheese, juice.... absolutely brilliant. Breakfast is served from 7.30 till 10.00 which wasn't good if you were rushing off to the Galleria Borghese and had to be there for 8.30, but otherwise it was nice not to have to be up and eat by 9.00 if you didn't want to. The staff were all really nice, and all spoke English. You can leave your case if your flight is later in the day, which was helpful. The area around the hotel is fine, as a single woman I had absolutely no problems, even at eleven o'clock at night. Rome in general is fine for a lone woman, just exercise the usual caution you would at home and you'll be fine. There are loads of shops, bars, pizzerias and banks nearby, as well as a Burger King on the Via Candia if you are craving a taste of home. There is a very nice bakery on the Via Barletta called Dolce Maniera which is open 24 hours, and they do lovely slices of pizza. Thoroughly recommend if you get back from the centre late and you're starving! It is right by Ottaviano Metro station. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, although it is not the best choice if you want to be right on the doorstep of ancient Rome. I hope to return, however!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: LauraCassimer
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, brilliant location right next to vatican museum and st peters. Lovely room, staff all very friendly and lovely buffet breakfast. Easy walk to metro station to access all the other attractions and a shop right next door. Also lots of resturants within easy reach. I would recommend this hotel if your going to rome for a few days and you want to fit in all the sights as theres not a lot of travelling needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great buy, great service and amenities, and good location”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastKit
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant stay. Price is reasonable for central Rome and location is on the north wall of the Vatican in a clean business district with access to subway for the Rome antiquity locations. Room rate includes a breakfast which is a fullbuffet breakfast that provides choices for all nationalities' tastes - American, English, continental European, and others, not just some hard rolls. Staff is very friendly and helpful, including maintenance and cleaning staff. Rooms are very clean as is linens. No skimpy threadbare towels and mukry sheets. Four block walk to the Metro stop, and ten minute walk into St. Peter's Basilica. Free in-room wifi is great for checking your flights and getting your email or doing skype. Showers are a bit tight in some rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel i have Found”
Reviews.Author: KeithGHullEngland
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel recently i can seriously recommend it to all. The Staff are terific and the breakfast outstanding. The rooms are large and very well equiped and are serviced daily by delightful and efficient maids. Street facing rooms have balconies and i would recommend that you upgrade to one of these rooms. Book this hotel and i guarantee you will not be disappointed. Travel Tip Get a Metro pass as soon as possible,getting around Rome is so much easier when you use the Metro

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Diplomatist
Reviews.Content: Great location -- near Vatican Museum, Vatican City, St Peter's Square, two metro stops. Very helpful and friendly staff. Our first room was a quadruple for two adults and two kids -- much too small. But the staff quickly moved us to a Junior Exec Suite, for a reasonable added charge, and the room was great. It had a very modern design, nice fixtures, great skylight. Breakfast was more than adequate, and service was good. Internet access was very slow, though, and we had to use the office computer to make online reservations for tours. Other than that, though, a very good hotel in the downtown area and a great value for your money (at least in the off season!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Thank You”
Reviews.Author: 2201Tam
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay and wish to pass on our sincere thanks to all of the staff. The hotel is situated very close to the Vatican Museum and St. Peters and just a few minutes walk to Cipro Metro station. The hotel rooms and bedding was immaculate - the breakfast was amazing - the staff were very friendly and helpful and I can honestly say the experience was 10/10. We were a family of five and were given two connecting rooms each with their own private bathroom. The purpose of our trip was to celebrate our Daughters 21st birthday - and I wish to say a big thank you for the fruit basket and card you left in the room for her. I am so pleased we picked the Spring House Hotel. We would love to return sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wheresh0uldweg0next
Reviews.Content: Great location near Vatican and subway, excellent and helpful staff, exceptionally clean, scrumptious breakfast, neighborhood restaurants are plentiful and very good, free internet. We are going to stay there again whenever we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “All around a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: beebee50
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was one of the nicest experiences I have had in a hotel and the reason we had such a great time in Rome. The staff was genuinely friendly and helpful especially Benie and the front desk staff and porter. All the staff, including housekeeping always greeted us and were very attentive. The room exceeded my expectations in amenities, size, comfort and view. It was taken care of by housekeeping meticulously. The breakfast provided was a nice variety of foods and very good quality. This place is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in town and centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: shoogied
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for convenience to have access to all the famous Rome sights then this is your hotel. It's a 5 minute walk to the Vatican Museum and 5 minute walk to the subway station that can bring you all over town with ease. The neighborhood is full of great people watching, bustling activity, shopping and restaurants that offer traditional delicious Italian cuisine. I had pasta, pizza and desserts that blew my mind. Right inside the hotel there is a complimentary breakfast that offers "the works". You won't find bacon and eggs in Italy but you will here and you can eat as much as your little heart desires. Tasty pastries, toast, cereal, fresh fruit and juices. Plus there is always a chipper and hospitable host to fill your coffee and accommodate any special requests above and beyond what is available on the buffet. A fellow named Benny was there on my vacation, he was friendly and always had a smile on his face (which is rare in Rome). We had a lovely stay thanks to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Personal Attention, Accomodations okay, Services questionable ,”
Reviews.Author: WorldPeace2
Reviews.Content: The morning breakfast was great. The first room we had was very small, however the staff, moved us, without any questions, to a larger room. The entire staff was very, very accommodating and helpful, especially Benny. Other than the cold water, for showers, internet services working sometimes, and the room beng extremely warm (with the heat off), our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, awesome service & great location”
Reviews.Author: anfield09
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights with our teenage children & loved the hotel. Our room was spacious, spotlessly clean with very comfortable beds & nice decor.The staff were all extremely friendly & helpful, especially Benny in the bar & breakfast room!. Breakfast was great, plenty to choose from & fresh. The location was fantastic, minutes walk to the Vatican, amazing!. There were plenty of nice restaurants close by & very reasonably priced. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, & were very impressed with everything the Hotel had to offer. It was a great end to our wonderful European holiday!!.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Hotel, Fastastic Location”
Reviews.Author: chasarDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location next to the Vatican Museum, good nieghborhood reflective of Rome. Less noisy and congested than the many hotels around the central area/termini. Neighborhood offers good shoppi9ng, restaurants, and a wonderful central market less than 2 blocks away. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: urtripfriend
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Best Western Spring House hotel. Most of all, the location was excellent. We were 5 minutes away from the Cipro metro, and 2 minutes away from the Vatican wall. Equally importantly, the hotel provides complementary gluten-free breakfast, which takes a whole load of worries away from us. We can set off the day without having to worry about what to eat. Every morning, the hotel waitress brings out a decent selection of gluten-free cereal, cookies, and cakes. Unfortunately we can't eat most of the food in the normal breakfast section (e.g. eggs). Another good thing about the hotel is the free wi-fi service. We have a laptop with us. Every night, we can take advantage of the free wi-fi to connect to the world. On the downside, the room is very small. As light travelers, the room barely fits us (we are not big people) and our luggages. But again, it's not surprising since the hotel is located right in the center of the city and we really only use the room to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Stay”
Reviews.Author: blindintellectual
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, though the velvet walls and the motorized window were and odd addition. Great service, spoke English, awesome bar keep (best food while there), Breakfast was awesome! Though they make you hand your keys to front desk when running about, which concerned me a little but nothing was pilfered. 110 plug in Bathroom!!!! but the 220 plug blew up my hair dryer even with converter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Benny is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: deckdecker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Spring House in September, and the trip was wonderful. The service was excellent, with Benny being a great help. We got a deluxe room with a baby bed, it was to small for a deluxe room. Not sure if they overbooked or what. Everything else was great. Thank you for the great trip.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: julia_hiker
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Spring House was great. The location was perfect because it was such a short walk to the Vatican/St. Peter's! We also walked to all the Roman attractions (Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc.) so no public transportation was necessary for us. I do agree with a previous writer, however, about getting off at the Cipro Station instead of Ottaviano-- we didn't realize that was the preferred stop either and had a bit of a time trying to find the hotel. And no, there's not a lot of nightlife and restaurants in the area but that was just fine with us. The breakfast buffet was the best we had on our European trip! Ask the front desk when the best time to go is, because the dining room is a little small and sometimes you have to wait for an available table. The tables were a little small too (for 2 adults and 2 children) but that was fine. As far as the room went, we were delighted to have a double bed and 2 singles pushed together. (It was hard to find that in Europe.) The alcove we had was very nice and gave us much more space to place suitcases so we weren't tripping on them. The beds were very comfortable and the maids made everything spotless each day. The staff at the front desk was also very attentive and gave me an emergency telephone message as soon as we walked through the front door. We didn't use the free internet access, but that was also a nice feature of the Spring House Hotel. We'd choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Generally, a pretty positive experience”
Reviews.Author: politikgirl
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hotel Spring House is located steps from the entrance to the Vatican Museums, which was great for our Vatican trip, and also great for mornings and nights when we wanted to take photos of St. Peter's Square, which was only a 10 minute walk from the hotel (great considering the size of Rome). The walk to the metro stop is about 5 minutes, which is a bit farther than we would've liked, but still fairly close given the size of Rome. The hotel itself is modern and nice-looking and the rooms had most of what we needed, although we did find our quadruple room a bit squishy and tight for 4 people (which makes us believe that the room was never actually meant for 4). The service was fairly good (particularly the room service attendant, who would bring us personal care kits with cotton pads and Q-tips every night, and one of the breakfast servers, who was the hardest working person I saw in Italy!). There was also free internet. I would definitely consider coming back another time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Laser36
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel specifically because it offered a gluten free station for breakfast. We stayed for 3 nights and found that the gluten free station wasn't restocked from day to day and we actually had to point out that some of it was out of date. Also, we went to the hotel bar the first night we were there at 10.25 as it said on hotel info that the bar was open until 11. The barman made a big issue of the fact that the bar actually closed at 10.30. We pointed out that hotel info said 11 but he said he needed 30 minutes to clean up. I felt this was an unnecessary argument as there was nobody else in the bar and it wouldn't take him 30 mins to clean up after our 1 drink. Needless to say, we didn't go to the bar again. I had informed the hotel that our party would be arriving earlier than the 3pm check in and had hoped we would be allowed to check in early. Unfortunately we weren't so we had to wander around for 2 hours before we were allowed into our room. Overall, it is a quiet, clean hotel with good service at the desk and a good pick up service from the airport. We also got a complimentary drink on arrival which was welcome. There is a nice gluten free restaurant just 2 blocks away. It is well located across from the entrance to the Vatican Museums. There are just some areas which could be improved upon.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 1-2 nights to see Vatican”
Reviews.Author: calitripCa
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel with friendly, English-speaking staff. Rooms are tiny but that's the case all over Rome. This is a great location for the Vatican and the price looks right. Try going to Pizzarium nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: flajann
Reviews.Content: We choice this place because when we got into Rome we had a Vatican tour planned for the following morning then were heading to Tuscany. First let me say that in general the Vatican area is not a great area in Rome. I think it is safe enough, but lacks restaurants, nightlife & is not near the other attractions. I was pleasantly surprised by the Spring House. We requested a room with a balcony & it was actually more like a covered terrace almost as big as our room. Everyone was very nice. Our room was clean & good size and our bathroom was very large by European standards. Their breakfast was excellent, a big selection of hot foods, cold, fresh pastries - the works! The cost for our room was inexpensive by Rome standards & for what we got I think this place is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “good location for Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Rhoda1234
Reviews.Content: Staff is very helpful and friendly. Excellent breakfast served by conscientious staff. Two minutes walk to Vatican Museum entrance, fifteen to St. Peter's Square; near Metro and many bus lines.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DLJC
Reviews.Content: First things first, please stop at the Cipro metro stop not Ottaviano (though on the train map this is considered the Vatican line as instructed by the hotel directions. The rest of the hotel directions are accurate). It really is quite a bit nearer. It was really lovely to come back everyday to a perfectly cleaned, quiet and nicely air-conditioned room after a hot, dusty day out in Rome. Toilet was a bit small...wi-fi worked well though on tv there's only 1 English movie channel and BBC. Located superbly near the Vatican entrance (up the stairs only one road away)and it was very convenient to take the metro or bus everywhere else (we got the 16euro 1 week pass which covers all public transport. Any 75min journey on the metro is 1euro if you buy individual tickets but we liked the convenience of the pass). Technically everywhere else you would want to visit is walkable from the hotel but it was too hot while we were there. Do try the Old Bridge gelato place (just opposite the Vatican walls) which is cheaper and better than many others we tried around Rome. Do not attempt to go to the Vatican museum on a monday morning. The other museums are closed so everyone is here! The queue wrapped all the way round the walls to St Peter's basilica. Just a few hours later at around 1pm, we walked right in with no queue at all. Every other day that we walked past, there was only a very short queue from about 11.30am. It is worthwhile going up to the dome of St Peter's (for 6.50euros) and nearby Castel St Angelo has a terrace with lovely views while you have a drink or snack. Fantastic little pizza/kebab place right opposite the hotel. More of a takeaway joint and very popular with good reason! There's a small supermarket just next door to the hotel as well. Would also recommend the Eden Walks and LivItaly tour companies. At some restaurants, wine sometimes costs the same or less than coke; be wary of drinks prices at some places. Cool drinkable water is readily and freely available at the many wonderful fountains everywhere you turn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value -- almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: WJ912001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in mid July 2009 as part of our Europe tour. The Spring House in Rome is one of the best quality Best Westerns I've seen. Although not centrally located, it is professionally/efficiently managed and superbly maintained. Hotel and room decor were top-notch --we only wish we had more time to enjoy our balcony. Location: Located on a quiet residential side street very convenient to the Vatican entrance. However, you will still need to walk around the Vatican walls to get to the entrance to St. Peter's Basilica. The hotel is also quite far from most other sights, though, so prepare to rely heavily on buses, metro, or taxis. As a residential neighborhood, the area does get quite deserted at night. Hotel: The hotel itself is quite modern, with a sleekly decorated lobby and attached bar. The one elevator -- though modern -- is small, slow, and mainly used during the day by Housekeeping, but the stairs are perfectly functional. The breakfast room downstairs is complimentary and has a fantastic spread of hot and cold offerings. Rooms: We found a great deal on Travelzoo which gave us a Superior room on the 4th floor with a small street-facing balcony. The decor is contemporary, though the room is on the small side. Bathroom is immaculate with surprisingly upscale toiletries. The Superior room also came with bathrobes and complimentary consumption of the mini-fridge. Service: Excellent. Not surprisingly, most staff members spoke fluent English, especially at reception and in the breakfast room. We left our luggage at the front desk with no problems. Check-in and check-out were both quick and efficient. Housekeeping does a great job. Our only suggestion would be to have the front desk knowledgeable about bus lines to key sights like the Forums, Pantheon, Colosseum, etc. Internet: Free wireless in-room as well as free use of a computer and printer in the lobby area. Value: With the Travelzoo deal, we paid 91 euros/night, which we thought was an excellent value for Rome, and one of the best values of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jgm2
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Only two hundred yards or so from the entrance to the Vatican Museum. Nice quiet street. Excellent staff who spoke excellent English. Very helpful front desk staff who organised taxis, wake-up calls etc as necessary. Their bar is a little small but the drinks were generous plus the barman was happy to open your own bottles for a night-cap so none of that annoying extra expense of buying your own cork-screw on arrival just so you can take all your baggage as carry-on. Showers and bathrooms are small but perfectly formed and good supplies of soap, shampoo etc. Free water bottles handy as you get a new one every day and the Romans are most generous with their public drinking fountains so you can top them up on the go. Did I mention how close it is to the Vatican? It's about 50m in a tank if you drive through the block opposite the entrance or 200m if you walk around the roads. Breakfasts are good. Cereals, cold cuts, sausage, bacon, egg, pastries, fruit salads, fresh fruits etc etc. Think of the money you'll be saving on (not buying) lunch and then blow it on dinner instead. We certainly did. Serving staff are friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: nstr24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to the metro station and Vatican. The room was clean and quiet. The breakfast room was always crowded but you can take a tray back to your room. You have to insert your card key to turn on the air conditioner which isn't good because you come home to a hot room each day....so it takes hours for the room to cool down. In terms of hotels I have paid a lot more money for a whole lot less so this is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Understand how this Hotel gets good reviews”
Reviews.Author: NyTraveler101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a cruise here are my pros and cons: Pros:Price(abt $100 USD a night), Location(about 3 blocks from Vatican City), and Breakfast( its free and its hot, Coffee is bad, but milk is good) Cons: Condition of rooms, The bathroom showers had mold on them, Sometimes they consider a lumpy pullout couch as a full. I stayed for 4 nights and each day i tried to get a new room and they just kept making up excuses. I do admit the hotel lobby is very misleading. I stayed here b/c i wanted to play it safe and stay at an American, but it was far worse than expected. There were much nicer, "no chain" hotels around this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good accomodations for 4 people!”
Reviews.Author: javabeancoffeequeen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right around the corner from Vatican. Next door is a grocery store which was convenient to purchase water and snacks for our stay. The hotel included a nice breakfast with our stay with eggs, sausage, cereal, yogurt, toast, bagels, pastries, etc. We liked the location because it was close to the metro stations making traveling to attractions easy. We have a 13 and 15 year old, so they gave us a room with a queen bed and two twin beds, which was so perfect! The room was a bit small for all those beds, but they rearranged the furniture to accomodate us and everyone slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MontrealShark4
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was excellent. Very well located and the rooms are clean and big for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean and good location!”
Reviews.Author: mmccormi
Reviews.Content: I spent nine nights at the SpringHouse to attend the 2009 Fina World Aquatic Championships. The hotel was a great choice for me. Very very clean, and an excellent selection at breakfast which was nice as it was good to have variety for 9 days! My single room was very small with a load bearing pillar in the middle (you'll never see this room in their advertisements) but it was comfortable and my balcony was gorgeous (almost as big as the room). The internet is free for only the first four days (thought that was a bit odd) but the front desk staff arranged for me to have it for my whole stay - much appreciated. Great location to the vatican and the subway. If you are coming by subway, ignore the reference on their website to get off at the Vatican Museum stop now called Ottavanio. That is one stop too soon - you should get off at Cipro which is closer. Apparently the stops have been renamed. Ottavanio is more in the core of activity and shopping but if you are lugging a large suitecase you want the shortest distance! All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a rome/florence trip. It's in a perfect location for visiting the vatican which we did both days. The city center is a short metro ride away. The rooms are small but have nice clean bathrooms. The TV was worthless but you don't go all the way to rome to sit in your room and watch TV. Breakfast was good (breads, meats, fruit, cereal, juice, coffee etc). If you take a cab make sure you have the address of the hotel with you because none of them know where this place is.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Tingeling
Reviews.Content: On this stay it was important to me to choose "the right hotel", so I did some research in advance. Travelling with relatives, I wanted to find a quiet, safe and resonably priced hotel. I read and compared reviews - both on Tripadvisor and other sites. Plus e-mailed the hotel directly. Their response was always quick and polite. I booked and went on vacation. Living in 21st century - with wireless internet even in "the stranges places" ;) I was able to take advantage of a better rate just before arriving at the Spring House. Feeling a bit "stingy" perhaps - here I had booked rooms way in advanced, now I cancelled one booking just to do another (at better rate). But told myself this is part of the game and reminding myself that a hotel wouldn't hesitate to sell "my" room to someone else for less. By the way - it's not all that easy to find the "cancellation" on their webpage ! Even if welcomed friendly, it was somewhat obvious that the hotel was well aware of this when I arrived (there's a fine line there...) However, the stay in itself was good. Nice and quiet location, nice people, esp the breakfast lady and the porter. Convienient grochery store next door. Great room - high floor and with balcony. Slow and hot elevator, but the hotel has only 50 rooms so that's not really a problem. No big issues and minor problems were taken care of efficiently. Tried out the hotel's "restaurant" (in the bar) just after arriving (starving !). Let's just say that the drinks were better :) Went to La Rustichella one night (short walk from hotel, restaurant mentioned in hotel's directory) : that was a good experience. Must mention that even if dinner at the hotel wasn't exactly memorable, breakfast was real good ! Over all : Spring House was a good experience. And certainly recommendable !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: debmacc52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Rome, where we stayed at the Spring House for three nights. I was hot and tired when we arrived and was afraid that our room would be the same as me! What a pleasant surprise! Our room was lovely, cool and featured a large balcony with a great view of St. Peter's dome. The staff was friendly, helpful and seemed to really care about the quality of our stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing a moderately priced gem in Rome. What a lovely establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: vondarkmoor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days and hotel staff were very helpful from directions to recommending places to eat, was not dissappointed once. If you get the chance ask for Rey one of the porters, very helpful as with all the staff. Rooms are tight but its Europe, Metro a short 5-8 mins walk and a short ride to all the sites. Vatican museum is next door and St. Peter's square 12-15 mins walk. Neighborhood is always alive and we felt safe walking around at night to & from Metro, but as with any city just be aware of your surroundings. This is not a 5 star hotel & location, but well worth the money. Very accomadating.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: HansTraveller
Reviews.Content: We was 2 families from Norway. Staff was exellent. We did feel very welcome here. The young man from Niger was served us a good standard of breakfast every morning in a exellent polit way. There was short way to visit many objects in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Nana35
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful cruise we found this little gem close to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublincoupleDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. While we did not expect a palace we were pleasantly surprised. The room was spotless as was the bathroom. Lovely bed linene changed every day and bath robes and slippers which is unusual for a 3 star. As an added bonus, the mini bar was free. Maybe because we booked a superior room. We had a terrance which had a view of the vatican. Breakfast was a full buffet, very tastey. The staff were really friendly and helpful. 10 minute walk to the vatican and nice restaurants close by. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gotsatravel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay. The front desk staff was very helpful. Rooms were clean. We had stayed here 12 years ago and the hotel was very good then....is much nicer now. If we ever make another return trip to Rome, we will stay here agan.

Reviews.Title: “Good Roma Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bari_ttc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a four-people-room and we have a good value of price. The hotel is next to the Vatican and very close to metro station Cipro. The service is very good and the front desk is helpful. We had a good stay in Hotel Spring house. p.s. The is a very nice gelato ice-cream shop in the main street next to the hotel, it is worth to try it, it is just so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Fantastic Location ......”
Reviews.Author: Jules094
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights to see the Champions League football and also to sight see, it was a last minute choice as our original trip had been cancelled by the company we booked through... We are so glad it was because this hotel was brilliant .. It is in a fantastic location for anyone who wants to be near the vatican... It is also close to the Metro so that makes getting everywhere in Rome easy. Hotel arranged our transport to and from the airport. We arrived very late in the evening but this was no trouble for the hotel. Breakfast had a great selection, Bennie was always happy to help. Sergio too was always really friendly in the bar and glad to help... We styayed in Romm 105 a double superior and it was great. Great kebab shop across the road for a late night snack... Rome was a amazing place and all the people were really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: travel1188
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! The staff was so helpful and really made our stay in Roma the best possible. Once we learned how to get to the hotel it was very easy, but originally it was a little hard to find. The location truly cannot be beat. 5 minutes to Cipro station and 5 minutes to the Vatican! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and sooooo close to the Vatican!!! - A Catholics dream!”
Reviews.Author: ConradsHelper
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The folks working at the front desk were so friendly and courteous. They helped us with directions and good food spots - always very nice. The rooms were modern and very comfortable and clean. The morning breakfast was out of this world! They had delicious items to choose from and very friendly service. The best part was the location for my wife and me. It is extremely close to the back wall of the Vatican - by the way that is where the entrance to the Vatican Museum is. It is an easy 10 minute walk to the front of the Vatican. My wife and I were mostly interested to going to the Vatican every day - so for us it was perfect! Close to nice food places and the metro. I would stay there every time I went to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Vatican Museum”
Reviews.Author: travel4value
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was what they said it was. It met all of our needs as far as price, cleanliness, and location. It is a 2 minute walk to the Vatican Museum, about 5 minutes from the Cisco Metro station. We enjoyed the free American Style Breakfast. The room ample size, Bathroom was a little small but workable. There is a wonderful mexican restaurant across the street. You can get to the hotel without a Taxi by taking the train to the Tremini station, and transferring to the A line to the Cisco station. aloow about 30-45 minutes. The neighborhood feels safe, although you will find that much of Rome is litterd and covered with graffitti. Once you get past that, and get into the sites, you will enjoy it. If you are looking for a good value hotel for a home base on your trip, this is a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very nice...”
Reviews.Author: Nzaar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in May 09. Service was nice, breakfast was great! Lobby and entrance was tiny. But after having visited Europe I now realize that bell boys and "beck and call" service and huge lobbies and gardens in a 3 or 4 star hotel is something you can enjoy only in Asia. The bathroom was tiny, but sparkling clean with hot water and decent pressure. The room was nice and clean. The TV showed only the english channels CNN & BBC. It was a bit pricey, but I guess that comes with the Best Western brand. It was maybe a 10 min walk from the metro. If you look at the map of rome, this hotel is immediately approx. 1-1.5 km to the north west of the St. Peter's square (I'm talking about the entrance, since you can't enter St. Peter's Basilica from the back). It might be the old part of rome, but it's not the historical centre where all the sights are... all the sights are immediately east of the river in the area surrounding Piazza Navona. It is, however, walking distance to the Vatican Museums and the Sistine Chapel (which is part of the Vatican Museums premises). Please keep in mind that in rome the historical centre is where you want to spend your day, and there is no metro station in that area (other than Spagna, which is near the spanish steps and the main shopping streets and Colloseo which is opposite the Colloseum...both of which border the historical centre and you have to walk 1-2 kms to the sights in the centre). All in all, great hotel and a nice location. Next time however, I will try to find a hotel bang in the historical centre or near the spanish steps, so when I step out, I am where I want to be.

Reviews.Title: “I took pictures of my room and my balcony, to always remember them.”
Reviews.Author: troutt
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome for a 9-day business trip, and decided on Hotel Spring House based on many reviews. My room was not ready when I arrived in the morning, but to make up for that, and to make sure I was comfortable during my relatively long stay, the manager gave me a small but gorgeous room on the top floor, with a balcony. The balcony had a trellis covered in jasmine flowers, and every morning I drank my coffee there and watched the sun rise, and listened to the nearby church bells. I loved the neighborhood as well: stately and elegant, a stone's throw from the Vatican Museum. The staff were gracious and helpful, and as a woman traveling alone, I felt protected. It's really a special place. Eve Powell, Philadelphia, PA

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tucson_AZDa1
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights, staff is very professional and helpful. Nice little bar with friendly bartender and the best breakfast in Rome. Clean, lots of amenities. Vatican Museum is close, but it's an uphill walk. Small room but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: SJDUDE
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on this site and they are all right on. Close to Ottaviano (not sure of the spelling) Metro station. 3 blocks away from the entrance to the Vatican Museums. Grocery store right beside the hotel, pizzeria (wuth great roman pizza!) right across the street. Large rooms, great american breakfast. It is located in a residential area, away from the touristy places so everything is not overpriced. There's a great gelateria for great gelato just 4 blocks away. The only reason why I did not give them 5 stars is the maid service is not very good. They cleaned up the room but forgot to give us new towels, and soap. The maid removed the slightly used soap on our first night and left us with no soap on the second & third night. This happened to both of our rooms (we booked 2 family rooms). We had to call the reception every night and ask for the towels and soap. Otherwise, everything is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, hotel is clean, staff are most helpful”
Reviews.Author: irishiiiiiis
Reviews.Content: We helped plan a vacation for my boyfriend's parents whom were vacationing with friends for a long weekend in Rome. We picked this hotel in large part based on the reviews from Trip Advisor. They just got back and thoroughly enjoyed their stay in large part because of the people at the Best Western Spring House. First the hotel staff was kind enough to help me coordinate a private van to pick them up at the airport in Rome. Now this may not sound like a big deal, but their luggage got lost and by the time that was sorted out they were 2 hours later then the planned pick up time. The driver waited without having a clue what had happened to the passengers he was supposed to pick up. So kudos to the Best Western for using such patient drivers. The weekend that they were there the Vatican was actually not opened on Friday and Sunday because of special services that were happening there. Once again the good people at the Best Western Spring House helped to arrange a private tour guide whom was very knowledgeable and also helped them circumnavigate long waiting lines, saving hours of time. The rooms are small, but that is true about almost every hotel in Rome. The hotel was clean and well maintained, the beds very comfortable and the location cannot be beat. The staff was thoughtful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel that is close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: airseamountain
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very close to Vatican Entrance and Metro. Closest Metro stop is "Cipro". Rooms were clean. Bathrooms were a little cramp but typical for European Hotels. Some rooms are noisy from road and elevator. We had two rooms. One was very quiet and one we could here some noise from the road. We didn't mind though. Breakfast was very close to an American breakfast and was good. Front staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Vatican - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tacalderon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two children. If your trip includes time at St. Peter's and the Vatican Museum, this hotel is very close. About a 5 minute walk to the entrance of the Vatican Museum, and about 5 minutes walk to a couple of restaurants recommended by Rick Steves. The breakfast is pretty good with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. and the hotel rooms are a bit small (compared to U.S. hotels). You get 4 free days of wireless internet, or you can use the computer in the lobby. The hotel staff is very friendly and responsive. My son left a toy behind in the room when we checked out, and I called the front desk from the airport and they said they would ship the toy to me free of charge -- you can imagine how grateful we were to hear this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumanthj
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and we liked the hotel and its very friendly english speaking staff. I can't remember the names but the ladies at the frontdesk helped me a lot with booking other guided tours. We had to open the window in room as it was a little hot and the room was a little small with our suitcases opened. Their breakfast is good and Very close to Vatican and Cipro Metro stop. Felt safe in the neighbourhood even around midnight. They even had the free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, very warm room room and don't make phone calls to the states from your room”
Reviews.Author: HemisphereRambler
Reviews.Content: Kind of off the beaten path, but I like that. Lots of good local places to eat not too far from here. Not the tourist traps you get in central Rome. More of an authentic Italian dining experience. We were out at the crack of dawn and back late at night so I was too tired to get out of my hot room and ask for another - my fault, but the room was very warm. Had to open the window wide all night and slept without blankets. Got in too late to use one of the phone/internet stores around the hotel so I used the phone service advertised in my room and was charged more for 3 phone calls than I was for my room! Kind of disappointing that the hotel would adverse this scam. The same calls cost me 3 Euro at the phone/internet store down the street. Great place to stay if you plan to hit the Vatican Museum and you will want to see the Vatican Museum - about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Breakfast was great with a very friendly staff. About 10 minute walk from the subway, which is limited, bu excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit St. Peters & vatican museum”
Reviews.Author: madmad1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Spring House is a wonderful hotel. We have stayed here 3 times now and would go back again. Great, helpful staff. Nice rooms, Just around the corner from the Vatican. DELICIOUS breakfast buffet. Within 2 blocks from the Metro station that will connect you to all of Rome. This hotel is very quiet and well maintained. The staff is very, very friendly and speak English. Recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean Hotel. Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: kingpatrick7
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hotel Spring House was a great stay. The room was very modern, large comfortable beds, and very very clean. Service was outstanding. The location is within great walking distance to the Vatican, but you pretty much need to take the Metro to get to any of the other attractions. There were a few good resturants and some nightlife around the vatican, but nothing special in the exact area around the hotel. Also, the internet was down the week we were there, but the hotel staff let us use one of their computers in another area. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was excellent! Book NOW! Do not hesitate!”
Reviews.Author: Nouzotres
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Spring House for four days and everything was perfect. No hassels.... We were four in a room- my husband and two adolescents.. and it was perfect. You must remember that the hotels in Italy are not the same size as Canada... however it was perfect. After all when in Rome to like the Romans. Their is even a small grocery store right next to the hotel and the metro is only one block away and you are two minutes from the Vaticans Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrewnn
Reviews.Content: A little off the beaten track but within 200 yds of the nearest metro station. It is very close to the entrance of the Vatican Museum and about 10 minutes walk from St. Peters. The staff were helpful and polite, rooms a little minimal but very clean and very comfortable. In comparison to other Italian hotels and cities this was excellent value for money and if I am truthful a refreshing change. It is a bit of a distance from the main tourist attractions but its proximity to the metro mitigates that. If you buy a three day pass its very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - we shall be back! ....”
Reviews.Author: Gerry50
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome, I was celebrating my 50th birthday and had a fantastic time! ..... The hotel was great and it really was just around the corner from the Sistine Chapel! ... The room was great. Breakfast buffet was great, everything was available from hot cooked breakfast to pastries, fruit, cereals, etc., etc., ! ..... The staff were excellent, very helpfull and friendly. My friend and I have already been talking to others about our stay at this hotel and telling them they must stay here also. Ohhh! ... I almost forgot - shopping is excellent too! .....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dancingf00l
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before our cruise. The staff was great. The rooms were small, but clean. Great location, walking distance to Vatcian and great restaurants. Included breakfast was a nice touch and delcious. You can't go wrong here. And the price is right also. There is a very small elevator ("lift). So can't get everyone and luggage in the elevator at the same time. And one of the floors the elevator doesn't reach, so if you have trouble with staris just make sure you don't get that floor. I think it's the fourth floor, but now sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for City Break!”
Reviews.Author: bobieh
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at this hotel. after having some problems finding it initially (we clearly missed the hude lit up sign poiting to the hotel) from the metro station, we were wet slightly stressed but was warmly welcomed by the staff. we were to early for check in but they took our bags, allowed us to sit down on the sofas and use any amenities we wanted. we were then given a map with all the tourist stops on it, metro map etc this was very handy and you will see alot of them about and they are great, if not slightly decieveing in distances between places. The room was not small but not large either, it was clean and warm. Only complaint slightly small bothroom but its only there to be used to wash and "use". The breakfast was very supprising, although not to my taste , i am a fussy eater. there was fruit cereal youghurt, bacon eggs sausages toast and pastries, all served with tea cappacino coffe esspresso juice. a very impressive spread. The location is near enough perfect for a city break. It is away from the main noise of the city, but 2-3 minuite walk from the metro station (best way to get around rome, advised to get a 3 day pass) and about 5 minuites from the vatican. It gave us everything we needed. For the price of hotel this is a great place to stay, clean friendly and just a welcoming place to come back to, could not rate it high enough!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Spring House, Rome - great!”
Reviews.Author: mlschless
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome where we spent 1 night in the Hotel Spring House. (We arrived a day earlier than anticipated and could not extend our apartment for another night, hence only 1 night at the hotel.) We loved this hotel! Located about 2 blocks from the Vatican Museum entrance, the location was perfect for a short walk to the Vatican for our tour the following morning. The rooms were clean, quiet, and just as described on the website. The staff was welcoming, attentive, and extremely helpful. (They helped us find Dino & Tony's - a fabulous restaurant on Via Leone that was one of the best meals of our trip.) The free continental breakfast was a nice extra. I highly recommend Hotel Spring House and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be before Christmas!”
Reviews.Author: MandarineBlossom
Reviews.Content: Good experience with this Best Western hotel in Rome, everything was just perfect, no problem with practically anything. The triple room was pretty normal size, though the view through the windows was not fantastic (tubes and pipes), but that did not matter at all. The bathroom was really clean, towels changed daily. Breakfast pretty rich, even with freshly made smoothies. Coffee offered many times, all the waiters really good mannered. Very close to Vatican, though the location was not ideal in general as a bit further from the city center. Reception staff very friendly and always ready to help, we felt very welcome all the time. Overall very happy with all the trip, thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff in a splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: riversmeade
Reviews.Content: We have had the most fabulous time staying in this hotel. O.K. we upgraded to a superior room and have a room on the top floor of the hotel overlooking the Rome skyline, complete with our private roof terrace. The room is large and airy and immaculately clean. It has a large bathroom with shower and whirlpool bath. It has an unlimited free WiFi Internet service, which we found very useful. It also has a FREE minibar, which is restocked daily - that is most unusual for a hotel like this. A nice touch were the sweets left on our bed one night. Without exception, the staff are excellent - most helpful and most pleasant. We particularly commend the reception staff, who dealt with our questions about Rome and its attractions both promptly and efficiently. Part of the Superior Room Deal is continental breakfast served in the room, but we have been choosing to eat in the downstairs breakfast room. Breakfast consists of a wide choice of really nice breakfast items, both continental cheeses and hams and pastries and breads and American style eggs and sausages. It is copious enough to satisfy the quantities, which are seemingly demanded by Americans on holiday stocking up for the day or is for the flood? The bar is small and intimate and fun and a bit limited in its stock but it does have a long list of cocktails. The metro is a five minute walk and the Vatican Museums five minutes walk as well. We have struggled to understand the Bus system as Bus maps are like gold! We are most grateful for the way this hotel has enhanced our trip to Rome. All is all it is nigh impossible to fault this excellent hotel and we will leave them with our thanks. Jacob and John

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lgriffith
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Spring House was in a great location, especially if you wanted to visit the Vatican. It is located within a block of the Vatican Museum entrance. The metro is within two blocks, but can be confusing to find the hotel the first time if arriving by metro. Get really good directions first from the hotel itself. There is also a self-service laundromat within a couple of blocks of the hotel. Our room was ample size, but the bathroom was pretty tiny. There were also small, benign bugs that occasionally cruised across the floor. Unfortunately you could feel the springs in the bed (is that why it's called "The Spring House?", but we still slept fairly well. The folks at the front desk were helpful and friendly, they had one computer that you could use, and there was a small bar that offered food. It was actually quite tasty and convenient if you didn't feel like going out. The breakfast was outstanding - the best on our entire trip! Not only did they offer so many different items, but they also had a small table of gluten-free foods, too. My husband really appreciated that! It's a bit far from the other sites around Rome, but the metro is close and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: josiesoma
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and were very pleased. Location is great; convenient and quiet. The staff was wonderful. They all spoke English and helped us get transportation, etc. When we wanted to confirm our flights home, we couldn't get into the computer in the lobby and so they had us use their private computer in the back office! They really were helpful. Breakfast was great both mornings - lots of choices with excellent pastries. Our rooms were very clean and we had plenty of space. The shower entrance was a bit small but other than that, we were very comfortable. Our fellow Americans seem to complain a lot about the size of the rooms but we had no problem at all (and my husband is 6'3" and weighs 290) We definitely would recommend this hotel and will also stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Are You Guys Serious? Not a quality hotel by any means!”
Reviews.Author: peony513
Reviews.Content: I am actually writing this review on the hotel's wifi as I type, meaning, I'm here right now. This hotel is a Best Western. Just like the Best Western you know and love back home, except about $150 more expensive. The rooms are: average, passable, and clean (as they should be). They are a little worn, as is the Best Western off the interstate back home. Pink velvet walls (not nice velvet, craft synthetic velvet) add to the, um, ambience. I picked this hotel because it was close to the Vatican, and other reviews were in love with it. I don't know f they just had low standards or what, but this is a basic two-star hotel, no more and no less. PLEASE NOTE: the hotel is close to the VATICAN MUSEUM and SISTINE CHAPEL. The ones where you pay 14 Euro for entry. It is not close to the St. Peter's enterance, where the actual church is. Neighborhood: Undesirable. Low-quality restaurants near by. Any area in Europe with a Kebap stands isn't exactly lovely. "Supermarket" next door is a strange discount store. Reception was brusque. Oh yeah, and my window opens onto a breathtaking view of the...air conditioners, black tar paper roof, and laundary facilities. Mmm hmm. For around $200 a night, you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in Rome”
Reviews.Author: atk1031
Reviews.Content: Hotel Spring House has a great location, just steps from the Vatican museums and close to a metro station. As advertised on its web page, it offers an enormous breakfast buffet that includes a little hot food, in the form of scrambled eggs, bacon, and sausage (which are a lot like hot dogs). In addition, the rooms are very quiet. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially in providing advice on the best way to get to a location that's not near a metro station. In case you don't feel like prowling the streets in search of dinner, the bar offers a sandwiches, pizzas, and entrees, plus a considerable beverage menu. The menu is limited, and not all of the few choices are available every day, but the food is reasonably priced and surprisingly good. One hard-working waiter does all the bar service, including food preparation and serving, and does an excellent job. My 5th-floor room had a small balcony with two chairs and a table, with a view of a small piece of the Vatican, making it a nice place to sit with a cup of (in-room) coffee or tea. All rooms would not have this. Minuses are the size of the rooms (very small, like most hotel rooms in Italy) and the minuscule shower stall (again, pretty typical for Italy). Also, the internet service is slow and somewhat erratic (but FREE).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Jams4
