Reviews.Content: A brilliant hotel next to Vatican City. Breakfasts were excellent with everything on offer. Friendly staff who were helpful, booking taxi giving travel advice and helping at all times. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Mommys_Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August. Travelling with 3 children ages 3, 5 and 7 I can highly recommend this hotel. We had the family room which was actually 2 adjoining rooms, with two bathrooms. Although smaller than North American rooms, the rooms nevertheless accomodated the 5 of us very comfortably and were nicely decorated. The rooms were IMMACULATE (and I'm very particular). The air conditioning worked well (important during August in Rome). The minibars and coffee/tea facilities were well stocked and the bottled water was free. There were lots of little thoughtful toiletries and candies on our pillow before bedtime! Our stay included a breakfast which included an excellent selection of hot and cold items, was well presented and well tended. All the staff were excellent-- the breakfast staff were friendly and efficient. The reception staff were also very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and spoke excellent English. Interestingly, there were a lot of Italians staying here. Finally, the location was good for us-- on a quiet street, and close walking distance to the metro. Moreover, we could see the Vatican walls from our room and the entrance to the Vatican Musum is just around the corner. There is a small grocery store beside the hotel which came in handy. I think there are also parking facilities. The only thing I didn't like was the amount of graffiti around the neighbourhood, but from what I've seen this is a universal problem in Italy-- I was surprised. This obviously is no fault of the hotel and the neighbourhood felt otherwise safe. My travellers tip: don't stay in Rome around August 15 (when we did!)-- this is a big national holiday and everything (banks, shops, farmacies, even some restaurants) is closed. It seems many Romans leave Rome for the last 2 weeks in August and mostly only the tourists are left! This was a problem for us cashing our travellers cheques at a bank without paying the exhorbitant 9.25% commission of the currency shops. The hotel was only able to cash about 100 Euros for us-- so we ended up using the Bancomats (bank machines) to take out cash. Nevertheless, we had an excellent stay at Hotel Spring House.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and enjoyable stay at Spring House”
Reviews.Author: CruisingFamily3
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three, two adults and our ten year old son, who stayed three nights prior to our cruise on July 9th. This was our first trip to Rome and The Spring House was absolutely perfect. We read reviews prior to booking and were not dissappointed. The staff was wonderful and polite. Although small, the room and bathroom were clean and modern and the air-conditioning worked very, very well. We had stayed in a Best Western hotel in Hamburg, Germany in 2005 and can rate this hotel on that excellent level. The breakfast was more than we expected with cereals, fruit, yogurt, pastries, eggs, assorted meats and cold cuts, breads and juices. The coffee had to be the best I had ever tasted. If we are ever lucky enough to visit Rome again, I would definitely book at the Spring House. We loved Rome and staying here made our visit comfortable. An added plus was the free mini bar stocked daily with assorted waters, sodas and other refreshments.

Reviews.Title: “"Spring your life" : we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: LAMMIE06
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three-night extended weekend stay at the Spring House. The hotel has obviously been renovated recently and is very clean. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is well located, particularly to visit the Vatican Museum. To get to the Villa Borghese and the Forum you have a metro station within walking distance. The breakfast was more than adequate, with good service and a big selection. We liked the fact that the mini bar was free and restocked every day. The location is also very convenient to reach from Fiumicino Airport. All in all, we would highly recommend this hotel especially for small families. As an aside, we loved the Mexican restaurant across the street, La Cucaracha. It felt like an American restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CapeBob05
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Rome, especially if you have children. Walking distance to subway stations, restaurants, and the Vatican. Rooms were very clean, choice of 8 pillows, free wet bar restocked daily, and an incredibly friendly and helpful staff. Extra bonus a small grocery store is right next door to help reduce the cost of drinks and snacks. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “5 star service ,3 star price.”
Reviews.Author: prw70
Reviews.Content: As a special treat for my wife and son who were celebrating momentous birthdays we came here for a week in April. We booked direct on their website and as we booked early received an excellent deal. The location really is as close to the Vatican as it says it is . From our balcony we could see the walls of the Vatican. To walk to the Vatican Museum was 5 minutes. As this was our first trip to Italy I asked many questions of the hotel . The responses were very prompt and the information very helpful to us. If you will be staying here for a few days there is an excellent grocery shop next to the hotel. It is called Spa. Good selelction of items and inexpensive. Breakfast was more than adequate. Good selection of food. Do note though that the breakfast room is in the basement and is small. There is a small bar . Reasonable prices and good prompt service . Overall we paid a 3 star price for 5 star service . Would definitely stay here again on next trip to Vatican and Rome.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION UNHELPFULL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: LalaHoustonTexas
Reviews.Content: Very good location right in Vatican city, the staff couldn't be more impolite and rude, They couldn't help us with the luggage since I was alone by the front desk with my baby grandaughter, they just stared at my while I try to mange to get the luggage in the car and hold my grandbaby as well. I don't recommend this hotel to families with small children. Not to say the list our room was in the seventh floor and the elevator goes to the sixth floor, so we needed to take a dark , narrow, inclined staircase to get to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: JoySacramento_CA
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four and wanted connecting rooms with two bathrooms for our Rome vacation. The family room at this hotel was perfect. We booked using the hotel website and contacted them via e-mail with our special requests. The staff responded promptly. One room came with balcony and both rooms were of reasonable size, non-smoking, very clean with comfortable beds, double paned windows and air conditioning that made them very quiet at night. The staff is extremely helpful. They arranged van service for us from the airport to the hotel, from the hotel to the cruise ship, and from the cruise ship back to the airport. They also arranged a private tour of the Vatican with a guide that met us in the lobby and walked us right into the entrance of the museum about 2 blocks away. The breakfast is a wonderful extra, many good buffet choices, and the staff in the breakfast room were so anxious to please that made my eggs to order. Room service for lunch one day for my daughter was prompt and perfect for a jet lagging family that needed some "comfort food" (french fries and a grilled cheese sandwich). The staff at every level (even the maid) was friendly and did everything they could to make our stay comfortable. This hotel is located in a very nice area with shopping, restaurants, and public transportation readily available. We walked around and found several nice places to eat, even a really great Chinese restaurant one night. If you are coming to see the Vatican you can't get any closer. If you want to go to the forum and colliseum it takes about 10 minutes by cab or you can take the public bus which is easy and cheap. Thank-you Springhouse. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cavite57
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the vatican. Staff were excellent and their breakfasts very good. The hotel arranged our transportation from and to the airport for a fee which minimized the stress coming out from a long flight. They have arranged some tours too and we were picked up right at our hotel. There is a grocery right beside the hotel as well.There is the old bridge gellatto going to st peter's square. You won't miss it. if you don't want long line ups, take the tours. Take the hop on hop off bus on your first day. Go for out of the way non touristy trattorias and ask for limoncillo after dinner.Get a map and allow yourselves to get lost as Rome is a walking city. Don't be afraid to walk around at night esp. on weekends. As a word of caution: hold on tight to your purse or wallets or bags.

Reviews.Title: “Spring house was great”
Reviews.Author: BigMiguel
Reviews.Content: This is the place if you're there for the Vatican. About four blocks to the Vatican Museum entrance. Also surrounded by lots of restaurants and Gelato. Comp breakfast was bountiful and catered to almost every western appetite. Rooms recently remodeled and beds very comfy. Our rooms had balconies that were clean and overlooked the street below. Front desk staff very courteous and spoke beautiful English. Reasonably priced for the ridiculously expensive city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: trako
Reviews.Content: Dates: May 6-7, 2008 Reviewer: A Trip Advisor Member, Holland PA We stayed two nights at the Best Western Spring House, prior to a Mediterranean Cruise. We picked this hotel for its location, literally a three-minute walk to the Vatican Museums, and its generally excellent TripAdvisor reviews. The hotel is small, but everything about it is great. Our triple room was spotless, the bathroom was small but functional, the staff was extremely helpful and courteous (special thanks to Jessica), spoke English, changed dollars to Euros for us, and arranged to pick us up at the airport and drove us to the ship at the end of our stay, for a reasonable charge. The complimentary breakfast provided by the hotel was excellent, with a wide variety of items, including scrambled eggs, bacon, and sausage. (Friends we cruised with stayed at a Marriot in Rome and told us they paid 30 Euro each for breakfast). We would stay at the Spring House again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Large Clean Room, Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: acruz96
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Best Western Spring House in early May 2008. Our room was large, updated and clean. The beds were firm and supportive. Our room had a safe, mini-bar and a small television. A small gripe about the room: whatever cleaning agent they use smells like an overpowering cologne (Drakkar Noir?) - and it smelled like they used tons of it in our room. It was overpowering but opening the window for about 20 minutes usually cleared the air. The hotel staff was friendly, helpful and spoke English well. As mentioned in other reviews breakfast was very, very good. Having delicious and abundant breakfast options included with your stay is a boon considering how weak the US dollar is right now. The breakfast room staff was very friendly and accommodating. Coffee is self-service, but if you want a cappuccino or expresso you need to ask. The location is great. You can walk to the Cipro metro stop, as well as the Vatican Museum, in 5-10 minutes. There is a grocery store next door where you can pick up snacks and beverages (and anything else you might need, really) for much cheaper than in the tourist shops. Also, there is a 'touristy' area full of restaurants nearby, near the Ottaviano metro stop. Walking back to Spring House from St. Peter's square you will pass a large square, where an electric train/tram runs. In that square there is a sandwich shop with delicious and reasonably priced sandwiches. (I will update this review with the restaurant name when I can.) This is a good option for lunch/dinner if you don't want to have a sit-down meal, or if you want to save some money. Further along the walk back you pass Old Bridge Gelateria - do yourself a HUGE favor and grab a cone here. Amazing stuff. Rome is a very expensive city to stay in, particularly for US citizens with the weak US dollar. This is a Best Western, which means it is a nice, clean hotel with the ammenities many US travelers expect. But, it is in Rome, which means it is expensive. That being said, it was the most affordable option we found during our extensive online search for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: dtreg
Reviews.Content: This is a great place all the way around. The location near the Vatican is great. Only a couple of blocks from all the main bus stops and the underground. The rooms are clean, the breakfast was wonderful and you won't find a more helpful staff. With all the choices you have in Rome, this is one to not pass up. I will stay there again when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: dolores77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Best Western Hotel Spring House for a special occasion. It was my sister's birthday and I decided to bring her to Rome. We really had a wonderful time, all staff was very helpful with us suggesting restaurants, reserving tours etc... Breakfast is delicious and all bar tenders very nice. Thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ajua
Reviews.Content: I had the greatest experience in Rome, Great location close to the Subway, Vatican City, 2 blocks away from Vatican Museum, great breakfast buffet which was really the most I enjoyed from our stay. Beautiful decorated rooms and the most courteous Staff in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: calatortravel
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff, very attentive to details (we found a fruit basket and a birthday card in the room on my birthday-they take a copy of your passport when you arrive). T he breakfast buffet has a huge selection and it is very tasty. It is a 3 minute walk to the Vatican museum entrance and it is between two subway stations (5 minutes and 7 minutes walk). It has a convenience mart right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mccarron
Reviews.Content: My family I stayed at Hotel Spring House last week while I was visiting my daughter who is studying this semester at John Cabot University. We chose the Hotel Spring House primarily because of location (within a 10 minute walk to my daughter's apartment) but also because of familiarity (my family stayed at the Hotel Spring House for a short stay in Rome a few years ago). We had a very pleasant experience then , and an even more enjoyable experience during our recent stay. In particular, your entire staff made my family and I feel like the Hotel Spring House was our "home away from home" throughout our stay. Besides your staff's friendliness, hospitality, and professionalism, we we were quite pleasantly surprised and touched when we received birthday greetings and a gift from the hotel staff on my wife's birthday ! We hope to stay at the Hotel Spring House the next time we visit Rome on holiday! Sincerely, John McCarron and family

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel Spring House”
Reviews.Author: Zekefried
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a trip to Rome , and I must say that the Hotel Spring House is a great spot .on a few blocks from the Vatican and the metro.The staff was very helpful.with may things . our room was very clean ,and the breakfast buffett had may thigs to chose from for a family of four .We will stay there again .Thank you to the hotel for a great time .=)

Reviews.Title: “perfect for what it is”
Reviews.Author: susanmarieelizabeth
Reviews.Content: amazing place. very close to Vatican. stayed in one of the smallest rooms ever, could touch both walls at same time, very comfortable bed, largish bathroom, closet, small desk. would stay again if i would need a room for one. internet didnt work in my room, although they said it would. they have computer in lobby for public use.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: reviewer80
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a long weekend at the Best Western Hotel Spring House in Rome and we had a great stay. The staff couldn't have been more helpful - booking taxis and restaurants for us, recommending places to see and how to get there. Our room was clean and comfortable and the hotel is a stone's throw from the Vatican and most of the main tourist sites. We also found a lovely restaurant about a 10min walk from the hotel called Napul'e - a real find as it was full of Italians and not like some of the tourist traps you find. Overall, we had a great stay at the hotel and would definitely recommend it for a short stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Spring House”
Reviews.Author: TheWhiteFamily001
Reviews.Content: After consulting Trip Advisor, we went ahead with our 3 night booking to the Best Western Spring House hotel. We were not disappointed! It lived up to all our expectations, including; hospitality, cleanliness, service and location. My husband, son and myself shared a triple room with balcony, which was spacious and very comfortable. The ensuite bathroom was compact and immaculate. Buffet breakfast offered a wide range of cereals, fruits and pastries as well as cooked breakfasts, including scrambled eggs, ( a winner with my son! ) frankfurters, bacon and toast. The hotel was within minutes of the Vatican and the metro station allowing very simple acces to all other sight seeing locations. Therefore we give the Best Western Spring House Hotel a 5 star rating! *****

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommo82
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I have just returned from a four night stay at the Spring House Hotel. Having read other reviews on here before we arrived I knew we would be staying at somewhere fairly decent but I was not expecting the hotel's description to be so accurate. The hotel although small is very clean, modern and well equipped. The staff are all very friendly and extremley helpful and all spoke fantastic English when our pigeon Italian was not enough. The hotel shows it self to be 3 star but I think they deserve an increase. I have stayed various 4 stars and I think the Spring House out shone them. We had a twin room which was quite spacious and had lots of room for us to move around without getting in one anothers way. The cleaner visits twice a day and each time left the room like new. The location is fantastic for access to the Vatican, being only minutes from the museums entrance and the metro station is just as close. There are also many italian restaurants local which all served fab food, and the bonus being they were full of locals not many tourists which made us feel we were getting the real Rome experience. The only downside was the bar food which we decided on one evening after getting back late from a trip to Florence. Although the prices were very cheap the food is all cooked from frozen and was not great but was ok for hungary stomachs ready for bed. The breakfast buffet was completely different. Lovely scrambled eggs etc and lots of fruit/pastries and other delights to choose from and to set you up for a day of walking around the sites. The other bonus of the Spring House is that it's situated next to a 'Spa' store which was handy to buy cheap mineral water etc and biscotti to take home. Much cheaper than the tourist shops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AC49er
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend break with my partner at the Hotel Spring House. The hotel was very pleasent, everything was clean and tidy, the staff were very helpful and could speak good english and understand our poor italian. Our room was a decent size and we could see one of the wall's of the vatican, its that close. A continental breakfast was served in our room each day which was ok, there is no resturant at the hotel, but there are plenty of good places within easy walking distance. We were very pleased with this hotel as our base for the weekend and would use it again if visiting Rome again. We also got a decent price by booking direct with Best Western rather than other companys.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay at the Spring House”
Reviews.Author: GM_Florida
Reviews.Content: Best Western Spring House Hotel is a great value in Rome. The hotel is in good condition and the rooms are updated and clean. If driving, the hotel is readily accessible, if you have good directions. However, parking is limited, so make a (extra cost) parking reservation in advance. The short side street the hotel is on is a little towards the unkempt, but the main street has some great shopping and the Vatican Museum entrance is just around the corner. If driving, the street parking in front of the hotel is limited, so make arrangements in advance. The first night, we ended up parking our car on the street a couple of blocks away, but despite all the auto horror stories we heard about Rome, everything turned out fine. After that night, and a couple of extended conversations later, the front desk staff was able to arrange parking in a private access, underground garage next to the hotel. The front desk staff was able to check us in quickly and provide assistance getting our luggage to our room. Typically, the single elevator was a snug fit for three and luggage, and took a little while to get up or down at ‘rush hours’. The updated fifth floor room overlooked the street in front, and had a quaint urban view of Rome and the western wall of Vatican City. The room itself was small ,but modern. The bath was a bit snug by U.S. standards, but typical of Italian hotels and in very good condition. The shower provided plenty of hot water, but again, was of the typical size for Italy. When in Rome …………….. The bed was a U.S. sized double, and comfortable. The room had a small balcony that provided some neat downtown/urban style views, and a good view of the wall of Vatican City near the museam entrance. The only drawback was the occasional conversation that drifted through the door to the connecting room as the American businessman staying there held conversations with co-workers back in the States. Otherwise the hotel was a fairly quiet place. The breakfast room is in the basement, and is well kept, clean, but a tad dreary with no windows. The food was a pleasant surprise and had a wide variety of meats, cheeses, pasties, fruit and American staples of eggs and bacon. Of course, there was also a good selection of coffees and juices. Location-wise, the hotel is very convenient to the Vatican; especially the Vatican Museum. The museum entrance is about a five minute walk around the corner. St. Peter’s is about another 15 minute walk further along the wall of Vatican City, with Castle Sant Angelo only a few blocks further. The main street next to the hotel is the beginning a of shopping/restaurant district that extends east towards the river, and a few blocks north and south (Don’t miss the night-time views from the walk along the river, and the top of Castle Sant Angelo). If visiting the other sights, such as the Spanish Steps, Pantheon and Coliseum, either prepare for a relatively long walk, or use public transportation The front desk staff spoke excellent english, and gave all appearances to be helpful. However, we learned to double-check any directions or recommendations they provided during our four day stay. This was the only down-side to an otherwise agreeable stay, and didn’t turn us off to the hotels other advantages.

Reviews.Title: “excelente.......”
Reviews.Author: chicoOcalaFla
Reviews.Content: Rome was a brandnew experience for my wife and I....I just want to say that the Spring House Hotel and its wonderful staff were by far the best experience we have ever had in folks that go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible...warm,kind and extra patient beyond all...And I have to say is that to the working folks, vacations are expensive..a place like the Spring House sure made all the sacrifice WELL WORTH IT......God bless every one of you...From Hernan and Jassica Gutierrez in Ocala Florida.........

Reviews.Title: “our priceless roman vacation”
Reviews.Author: williambeu
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel from december 9th to the 14th of 2007 this hotel is underrated. by far in my standards this is a 5 star plus hotel, not only for its cleanlness but the outstanding staff, that made our stay flawless. my mothers first trip to italy was the greatest thing that my brother sister and i could have ever given our mother and the staff at this hotel made everything perfect. there is not one unfreindly staff member at this hotel they all went out of their way to help us with any need possible within and beyond their means. i asked to have at least one room that we could at least see a little of the vatican and my mothers room had that. to look out the window to the left and see to dome of st peters church, was a blessing for my mothers first stay. we as a family would like to thank every staff member for the outstanding service and we surely will reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katty127
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights from the 15th-19th December with my partner. It was brilliant, just want we needed. On arrival the hotel staff were brilliant, we found the room on first impressions to be very small but once we'd got use to it, it was fine. Everything in the hotel was extremly clean, usefull lift to rooms, six floors in total, breakfast was good and everyone extremly friendly. Reception staff recommended a different resturant every night and all of them were brilliant. Hotel situated about 5 minute walk to the vatican city, 5 minutes to bus stop and about 10minute walk to the local metro station which takes you across the city, spar supermarket next door. If your looking for a great location hotel with good standards and friendly staff this one is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “High quality standard”
Reviews.Author: sandycasey
Reviews.Content: Best Western Hotel Spribng House is really a good hotel because rooms are cleaned, breakfast was delicious and the staff is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: StefTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay for four people after reading the reviews written here. While the rooms are a lot smaller than we were used to and the graffitti on the streets outside worried me at first, the hotel worked out just fine for a place to sleep, get free continental breakfasts delivered to the room and to check e-mail with the free wireless internet they offered. The service was outstanding and the staff was always prepared to help. We had a queen and two twins in our room, the two twins were the equivalent of portable beds brought in and placed around the queen bed. A little cramped at first but we spent most of our time outside of the room so it didn't matter. Bathrooms are small also but the service staff keeps them very clean as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Frenchy1711
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable, quiet location but minutes from subway, Vatican Museum. Staff extremely friendly and helpful, breakfast plentiful. We loved this place and would return and will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loumonster86
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the hotel, the staff were very friendly, and we got a complimentary cocktail on the house, which was great! The hotel was very easy to find, and only a 2 minutes walk from the Metro Stop so it was a perfect base for travelling around Rome. Our room was one without a balcony, it was small, but it did the job perfectly as we were only there for three nights. The breakfast served in the mornings was fab, big variety for all people - eggs, bacon, sausage, breads, cakes, cereals, fruits, yoghurts, smoothies, fresh juice, tea, coffee....excellent choice! The only thing we struggled with was restaurants - being very typical tourists we didn't know much Italian, and a lot of the restaurants near the hotel appeared to be aimed at the locals and not the tourists, which could be expected I suppose. I also struggled a lot as I am a Coeliac, and can't eat Pasta or Pizza, and it seems that the Italians LITERALLY don't eat anything else. We ended up getting a Metro to the Piazza Novana just to get me some food I could eat. There really are not many restaurants around the vacinity of the hotel. Still, the hotel was nice, super location! We definately recommend the trip up St Peters Basillica (5 euros for the long walk, 7 euros for the lift + steps up!) the views are amazing. Inside the Basillica is amazing too!! The Fora Romana is incredible too! Entrace to the Colliseum nearby also gets you into the Palpatine, which is the hill within the Fora Romana, excellent views and plenty of great ruins to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandYorkie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a four night stay at the Spring House Hotel after reading the reviews for the hotel on this website. We were not disapointed. The location is so close to the vatican, and within walking distance to most other major attractions. The room (26) was clean, a good size and comfortable. The only thing I will say though is that the walls were a bit on the thin side, and you could hear other people next door at times. The staff though were brilliant and so helpful. Our first night there we arrived tired and were recommended to a restaurant within 5 mins walking that was perfect. They were so helpful with recommending places to see, pointing us in the right direction and calling us a taxi if we needed it. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cc2Wales
Reviews.Content: Although the Spring House is a small hotel the staff are polite, helpful and friendly. Our room was a double and was adeqate for what we wanted ( a base to visit all the sites) It was clean and pleasant , although the shower cubicle was rather small ! The breakfast room is quite small but the breakfast was good with plenty of variety.A cosy, welcoming hotel. The hotel is only 5 minutes from the Vatican with plenty of shops, bars and restaurants around. We reccomend you try Ristorante ai Musei in Via Santamaura, just around the corner near the Vatican wall. It is a family run business and the owner (Marie)made us very welcome and even gave us a complimentary desert and lemon liquer and the price was right ! Rome is a wonderful place to visit. , we suggest you use the open-top ,hop on / hop off bus to get around all the important sites.Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spring House”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveler2008
Reviews.Content: We loved the Spring house. We stayed there a week and a half and it was our little home away from home

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: manuselk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner In August, first for four nights, then for one at the end of the holiday as we were flying back from Rome (we had been to the South of Italy in the meantime). First thing to say about this hotel is that the staff are truly excellent. Friendly, helpful, and happy to oblige with any requests. Secondly, the hotel is well situated if you want to stay somewhere quieter a bit out of the centre. The hotel is near the Vatican in a quiet side street in an area that is not that busy with tourists. It may at first seem a bit dead in the evening, but there are in fact a number of good restaurants in easy walking distance, varying from cheap to quite expensive. As public transport is good and cheap in Rome, it is very easy to get to any of the main sights. We stayed in two different rooms. The first, longer stay we were in a fantastic room. Though not massive it was spacious enough for a city hotel and had a great balcony overlooking St Peter's dome, with a table, a few chairs and a sun lounger. The room was very pleasantly decorated and clean. The second stay, for just one night, was in a room without balcony. While also pleasantly decorated this room really was small, and you would certainly not want to stay there with child. The breakfast is pretty good, though the breakfast room gets crowded. Overall, this hotel represents very good value and I would recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Vermont30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights as part of our honeymoon. We stayed for 4 nights when we arrived in Rome, then went up to Tuscany for a week. Then, we came down to Rome again and stayed at the Springhouse for another 2 nights. This is a great hotel! All of the staff is friendly and curteous and very helpful if you have a question- they speak very good English. When we had a problem with another hotel in Rome and wanted to get out of there, we immediately called the Springhouse and they were able to accomodate us again- thank goodness! The hotel room and bathrooms are very clean. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is nice, safe, and quiet. Breakfast is also very good- they have a variety of cereals, pastries, fruit, and a few hot selections. The hotel is a very short walk to the vatican museum. We were able to walk to most of the major sites (though some are quite a hike). There are also 2 metro subway stations within short walking distance if you don't like to walk that much. The first time we stayed here we had a superior room which was very large and spacious. The second time we had a standard room which was smaller, but not bad at all. They also offered free internet access for 4 days. I would recommend this hotel for anyone on vacation in Rome- singles, couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Spring House”
Reviews.Author: anon14London
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here when on a break with my parents. The breakfast choice was excellent, with fresh milk and hot food. The room service menu is very reasonably priced and the food is good. The rooms are not the biggest but very clean. I have stayed in cheaper hotels in central Rome, but this is worth the extra money. A word of warning about taxis from the airport - we were charged €100 in one of the taxis we picked up at the airport. It is much safer to arrange transport with the hotel - we booked a car to return to the airport for only €50. It is an excellent location, only a ten minute walk around the Vatican Walls to St Peters, where you can pick up any of the open top tour buses. Another warning - these buses are excellent but not reliable in the evenings, we waited for over an hour for a bus in the centre on the Saturday evening and eventually had to walk back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RogoWindsor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights with my 87 year old father. An exellent hotel, small and friendly. The rooms were clean and well equiped. To the delight of my father there was a kettle provided with tea, coffee and milk. Staff were always helpful with information and advise. The hotel is in a fairly quiet area but within a ten minute walk to the Vatican, restuarants and a small supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: Mooncat2007
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Best Western website. We stayed for 3 nights from 20 Sept. Hotel is a great location for being near to the Vatican and Vatican Museum. Room, hotel and staff were more than satisfactory and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “loved the spring house”
Reviews.Author: carlyEngland
Reviews.Content: what a great find! the hotel was in a brilliant position for st peters & vatican museums- easy to reach central rome by either metro or bus. hotel was modern, spotlessly clean & staff bent over backwards to help with any queries. all staff spoke english & the breakfast buffet included full english breakfast which was to a high standard. would stay there again & would recommend anyone to stay there if they wanted a stress free, relaxing time in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Overscan
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for our party of 4, one was very nice but a little small, the second was a good size with a balcony. As its a small hotel the rooms all seem to be slightly different shapes and sizes, but we soon got over the slight disappointment of the smaller room. The staff were all impeccable, friendly, and mostly spoke excellent English. The location is really excellent. Vatican on the doorstep, and Cipro Metro station is 5 minutes walk for quick travel to Central Rome, and the bus stop just outside the hotel has the 492 bus to Rome railway station which is another good way to get into town. La Rusticella restaurant serves great pizzas and pastas, the Milennium Gelateria brilliant ice cream, and both are less than five minutes away. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel made very good by staff”
Reviews.Author: laygatelad
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 is just back from a week here., We liked it a lot.Rooms comfortable and v quiet( may be a little noisier if you are on the front but it is still just a side street) , v good aircon and a nifty little bar serving drinks and snacks at v reasonable prices.nearest metro,Cipro, is just 5 mins walk away(you can be at the colosseum in 25 mins),and you are on hand for non-tourist,normal shopping areas.Even the attractions on the otjher side of the river eg piazza navona are just an easy 30-45 mins walk away . what really made the hotel stand out was the staff. they knew their stuff and were just keen to help,and in a genuine,person to person way,not just because they had been on a course.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveler37
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Best Western Spring House Hotel based on recommendations on Trip Advisor. As other reviews mention, the rooms are small. I had a single room and it was just your basic bed, small desk and bathroom. The room and bathroom were extremely small but, the cleanliness was very good. The mini bar offers complimentary mineral water which is a welcomed comfort during the summer months in Rome. The air conditioning was also a welcomed friend after spending a long day out in the heat. Note: In order for you to work the lights/air conditioner you must insert your "card key" (included with the key to your room) into the slot as you enter the room. Doing this activates the electrical system. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. They offered recommendations to local restaurants and were up to date with openings of tourist attractions (i.e. Vatican, etc). The location to the Vatican Museum is very close - no more than a 5 minute walk literally around the corner from the hotel. The metro stop (Cipro) is about a 10 minute stop from the hotel. The breakfast was alright - not the greatest. They offered eggs and breakfast meats but, they seemed alittle too greasy for me. Overall, this was a positive experience. The prices seemed alittle too much for such a small room but, at least the location is very close to the Vatican and St. Peter's Basilica. And hey, your in Rome, are you really going to be spending that much time in the room? If your looking for five star luxury, to lounge around in your room, then this is not the place for you. However, I would recommend this hotel to those that are interested in a good location and being out and about seeing the sights of this historic city!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Was Great!!”
Reviews.Author: sandym2907
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip and spent 5 nights at this hotel. Very enjoyable, everything was clean and updated. We had a quad room and upon checkin, I asked for a room with a balcony. The mini bar was free, so we had cold drinks in the room, which was great. The breakfast bar was plentiful, with eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, fruit, yogart, fresh pastries, and juices. They also made you cappuccino upon request. The room for comfortable for four people, the shower was small but we figured it out!!! Great proximity to the Vatican and to the Metro Station. The only bad side was everything in this area seemed to close up early at night, but there was a Mexican restaurant and a pizza bar right across the street which was convenient. Would recoomend this hotel again to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Wizzjanco
Reviews.Content: Good location - near Vatican, easy transport to all other attractions. Comfortable "superior" room - plus safe - complimentary slippers and dressing gowns - good bathroom - huge variety for breakfast and lots of it. All reception staff very welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for my family of 5”
Reviews.Author: travelerj06
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome. This hotel had two key advantages, its proximity to the Vatican and its excellent front desk staff. The only down side that I can think of was the small shower in the room. Other then that this hotel was a perfect fit for my family of 5. I had two adjoining rooms. The front desk helped me get my rental car, directions to the metro, suggested restaurants, and tours and was a great resource. We used the metro a lot and this hotel was about a 5 minute walk to the closest stop which worked out well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: ucla_kat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Spring House this July. Great hotel near Vatican City -- about a 1 minute walk to the Vatican Museum (but if you count the time to walk to the beginning of the line during peak season, maybe 5 minutes)? About 5-10 minutes to the nearest metro station (Ottaviano I think?). Very convenient to St. Peter's, Vatican Museum, and Castel S'Angelo. Other tourist sites are just several metro stops away. Hotel is very clean and great selection for breakfast. We stayed in a quadruple room which was very hard to find in Italy. Cozy, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spring House”
Reviews.Author: CiaoClaudia
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Steps from the Vatican Museums & St-Peter's. Staff was extra friendly and helpful. Room was small but very confortable, clean and very nice decor. We arrived early in the morning and although the room was not ready yet, the invited us to have breakfast and to freshen up in a very nice and big bathroom. Basically treated us like family! Very good location for shopping also on Calo di Rienzo, close by. I highly recoomend it and would go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice..”
Reviews.Author: Midinho
Reviews.Content: Following the good reviews , our stay at the Spring House was spot on.. Close to the vatican , close to transportation ( taxi , subway etc..) and with a good level of comfort and service , Spring House was definetely a very good choice for our stay.. A little word about the attentive and dedicated service of Terezinha at the breakfast....which was delicious.. Will come back.,..

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled reservation and they still charged my credit card!”
Reviews.Author: djr4
Reviews.Content: I cancelled my reservation and stayed at the Hilton at the Rome airport. The Spring House Hotel still charged me for one of the two nights I had reserved.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicbarr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. It is located within walking distance of the Vatican. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. They recommended a restaurant within walking distance where we had a fantastic meal. There is also a great ice cream shop just around the corner. The hotel arranged our taxi to the airport, we got a suited chauffer in a Mercedes people mover, all for 50 Euros! The rooms were really clean and the breakfast was by far the best we had during our trip. Just two streets away there is a food market which sells a huge array of meat, fish, fruit, vegetables, bread and pastries. We would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marsh2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Hotel Spring House for 5 nights on 6 July 2007. This hotel is a greal little gem within just a 3 minute walk to the Vatican Museum entrance. The location is quite a distance away from the rest of the sights but public transportation including taxi stands are all close by. The street its on is quiet at night and we've walked it in the wee hours with no problems. From the moment my sons and I arrived, the staff makes you very welcome. They are extremely customer oriented and I'm talking not just the front desk. The rooms are typical european sized, meaning a tad small by american standards but clean, modern and well-maintained. Breakfast was consistently good and offered enough variety. The shower is tight. You can barely turn around without rubbing the walls. Still the bathroom is clean and modern. They have a small bar where you can order drinks and meals. Its pretty handy when you've done a full day of sightseeing and want to munch something light (or heavy) before you head on out again. Overall, this hotel is one of the best bargains in Rome. Definitely recommend this to couples, families, seniors, and budget conscious travellers who want a little bit of luxury and the most bang for their buck.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelRome
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed at the Best Western Spring House Hotel at the end of june through to july 2007. Our stay was absolutely excellent. Its right by the Vatican and within walking distance of everything you want to see. The metro is nearby too. The hotel room was very good, bathroom was very nice, it was kept very clean and air con was much appreciated. The hotel staff are brilliant nothing is too much trouble. They will order taxis for you and check your day trips out for you. They are very friendly. The breakfast in the mornings was very good especially their what tasted like a banana and kiwi smoothie very yummy. We will definately be coming back here again. Rome is a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Spring House Best Western”
Reviews.Author: tasisfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 kids(4 and 5) stayed at the Spring House Hotel. It is a 3 star hotel, but 5 star service. The rooms are clean but small. The service at the hotel was outstanding. The staff were very helpful and informative. We asked for a recommendation on a restaurant and really enjoyed the food. It was only a couple blocks away and the food was outstanding. We went back to eat there a couple of times. The helped with confirmations and bookings. The hotel breakfast was good as well. Plenty to eat. The area around the hotel is not the best, but I did NOT feel it was threatening even with 2 small children in the evening. The Vatican is just right outside the hotel. It is a great location for sight seeing. We used Bob's Limosuine Tours and would recommend using them as well. The were punctual at the airport to hotel. (Our flight was late arriving and they waited) As well as taking us and picking us up from our cruise at the port. EXCELLENT!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gr8scribbler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I'd hoped for. The location was great, and the staff were excellent. They will go out of their way to be helpful! The reception staff confirmed tours, called taxis and generally gave good advice. When our tour left before breakfast, they gave us a selection of croissants and juice so we didn't miss breakfast. I will definitely return! BTW, for a cheap meal, there's a Pizza and Beer place about three blocks away where we lunched for between 16-26 Euro, and the food was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very good option...”
Reviews.Author: IvanV
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located. You are literally just two minutes away the entrance of the Vatican Museum. The Vatican itself and the Piazza San Pedro are within walking distance. The neighborhood is not very pretty, but Rome residential areas aren´t either. Several small and decent restaurants are within walking distance in the neighborhood. Rooms are well maintained (recent refurbishing is evident) and quite spacious considering European standards. Breakfast is surprisingly varied, and in good quantities. Staff is very efficient and agreeable, willing to assist you on any demand. The hotel is not cheap, but should you are looking for a good quality accommodation it is worth the price. We rented two rooms (3 adults and 2 small kids) and certainly recommend this hotel. ..

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrippersNorwich
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with two children under 9yrs. We booked this hotel purely on recommendations on Trip Advisor and I have to say we weren't disapponted. The staff were so friendly and were very pleased to recommend places to eat etc. They arranged our transfer to FCO Airport and for 50 Euros we had a suited chauffeur who looked after our luggage and took us straight to our terminal. Better than having to trawl around Rome picking other people up which we were quoted 45 Euros for. The kids enjoyed breakfast - very English. The breakfast room is small but we never had to wait for a table. Our room had two double beds and was not cramped. The bathroom was small and the bidet got in the way!! My only criticism is that if you have the misfortune to stay on floors 5 or 6, you wont believe the noise when it rains! Luckily it only rained twice but it did keep me awake. All in all, a really good, family friendly hotel and we would certainly return. Just ask for a low floor........

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: blibble
Reviews.Content: We were a group of five females, including mother (in her 80s) so I chose this hotel based on reviews I read in Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed - it was clean, staff was friendly, the lift was great, breakfast was excellent. Yes, the rooms are small.... but that was not an issue for us. The bathroom was modern and spotless. I think, to get extras like slippers, robes, free minibar, balcony, and whatever else mentioned in previous reviews.. you have to choose a superior room and probably pay extra. We didnt, so we just availed of the free minereal water replenished daily in the fridge. Our rooms were at the rear of the hotel which meant there was no street noise. Most of the balconies seem to be at the front so you pays your money....! The surrounding area is very safe, nothing to worry about. Also, I would have no sense of bad practice by cleaning staff - nothing we left in the rooms was interfered with. We tried three restaurants - La Rusticella (food good, a bustling place and very near); Piacera Molise (lovely family atmosphere, a slow pace, so don't go if you're in a hurry! - voted our favourite) ; La Caravella, Via degli Scipioni (food generally good, except for the lamb which was disappointing). The gelato place around the corner was a big hit - we revisited it a few times. All these places are within walking distance of the hotel. Reception called taxis each time we wanted to go out, and we never had to wait more than five minutes. To get from the airport I had pre-booked with maurizio montini and got very good service. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: morrisla
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May. We had a large double room which was very clean and spacious and had TV and free mini-bar which was replenished every day - great!! The only downside was the tiny shower cubicle - the shower itself was great but the cubicle was barely big enough to turn around in. The continental breakfast was lovely - fruit/meats/yoghurt/cakes/toast etc. The hotel is about a 5 min walk to the Vatican museums and about a 15-20 min walk to St Peters. We walked to Piazza Navona for dinner a couple of nights and it took around 45 mins. There's a metro station about a 10 min walk away and it was very cheap and easy to use. Had a great holiday and would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: drums
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Spring House Hotel [Best Western] and had an enjoyable stay.I would not recermend staying in this hotel if you like a good quality meal in the evening. It is not a good area for fine dining. On the first night , we were recommended the best local restaurant by the hotel receptionist. My dad ordered some lamb,which turned out to be the worst meal of his life! It was all bone! But round the corner there was an ice cream shop which was in the top 5 best ice cream shops in Rome !Well worth a visit! On the second day we had a tour of the Coliseum and Roman Forum with Angel tours. I would give it an ok. On the third and final day we had a brillant , fabulous , interesting professionel tour of the Vatican .The name was Trinity tours. If youre going to St Peters make sure you find a tour by them(they should be at st peters squre) and look out for Roberta [cost 25 euros]

Reviews.Title: “small single rooms”
Reviews.Author: nurse_niki5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night at the end of a Tuscany vacation. It is near the Vatican, a neighborhood in which I was very comfortable as a single woman travelling solo, and the room I had over via Mocenigo was nice and quiet (for Rome). The room itself, however, was so small that I could reach out and touch each side of the room - it was perhaps 5 feet by 15 feet long. Granted, I didn't require much but it was TINY! Walls were incredibly thin. No restaurant in the hotel. Staff was nice but I requested a wake-up call (from 2 different front desk personnel) and didn't get it - almost missed my flight home. Overall it is adequate but fairly spartan if you're travelling alone. And bring your own alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: London_Escapee
Reviews.Content: I was drawn to the Spring House when trawling the 'Net for a hotel in Rome for some reason, and we were certainly not disappointed when we checked in. I had requested an upgrade from a superior room to a Spring Room online (communication from the hotel was quick and helpful) and that's what we got. The room was large, as was the bathroom. The corner jacuzzi was not working unfortunately. We had a large balcony which had table and chairs and a sun lounger, and masses of jasmine which smelled fantastic. The free minibar was a refreshing change, and included beer and sparkling wine as well as water and soft drinks. Bar was rather small and the breakfast room was somewhat stuffy, but you need stay in neither for long. Breakfast was more than enough and tasty. All the staff were so very helpful, courteous and friendly and spoke good English. The Metro is a short walk away and we used buses too. Our stay was only 3 days as we had business elsewhere in Italy and we intend to return at a later date.

Reviews.Title: “Super in every way.”
Reviews.Author: JHVG
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great hotel. Very clean. Wonderful front desk staff. Excellent breakfast. Super location. While the bathroom is small, it was very functional. Nice balcony.Great location. Many small restaurants near by. The metro stops about 3 blocks from the hotel. A five minute walk to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location for the vatican”
Reviews.Author: stonywoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights last week with my mother. I chose this hotel as my mum insisted on staying somewhere with tea/coffee facilities in the rooms and this is hard to come by in Rome. Also wanted to be near the Vatican. We could hardly have been closer. Hotel staff were great, especially the young girl behind the bar (didn't get her name) and Paolo on reception. Very helpful. Yes its a small hotel and yes the rooms are small but everything is perfectly formed. And bar prices are very reasonable. Also so convenient for the metro, though next time I would probably stay somewhere closer to the centre for a change, as the metro doesn't go very close to the centre and therefore you have to do so much walking in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, scrupulously clean, fab staff, would stay again in a flash!”
Reviews.Author: GirlStar1
Reviews.Content: This is a great city centre hotel designed to be a place to sleep, eat brekkie and get on your way. It is exceptionally clean, the staff provide a fantastic service and the breakfast buffet will set you up for a whole day of trekking round the sights. Don't be suprised that the rooms aren't palatial - it's not a sprawling country mansion. But they are well appointed and spotless with brilliant showers, air con & complimentary mini bar which was re-stocked daily. We loved the Spring House - it's location is spot on and you really do get lovely customer service from everyone, cleaners, front of house, managers, waiting staff etc, and they will do anything to help make your holiday go without a hitch. Our room was on the ground floor, above the restaurant and at first we were a bit disappointed with the size but we were there to see the sights and soon realised we valued the location and a cool bed in the afternoon over anything else! It was great to have a city centre location but without lots of noise etc. We will be staying there the next time we go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjamado1
Reviews.Content: We returned from a 10-day-stay in this hotel during Easter and have to say that I would go back tomorrow, no concerns. The hotel is well located; well within walking distance of the Vatican museum and quite close to the St Peter’s Square. The room that we got assigned was a bit small, however the staff made everything possible to makes us feel good as we were traveling with our 2-year old daughter. The room was very clean. Sheets and towels would be changed every day. The lobby is not big and the bar is quite small, just a few tables. There is a cafeteria area downstairs for breakfast, which it can get a bit crowded at times, but again the staff makes you feel like at home and would do their best to satisfy your needs. There is a good selection and quality for breakfast food. Also, there is wireless everywhere in the hotel, but not for free. The hotel does not have any amenities, so I don’t advise to spend much time in it, other than the night. It is located between two Metro stations (Cypro & Ottaviano) which can take you to most places in Rome and it comes very handy when returning after a long day walking in Rome. There are plenty of restaurants and “tavola caldas” around this area. Specially between Giulio Cesare and Cola di Rienzo.

Reviews.Title: “Chamber maids are thieves”
Reviews.Author: sangram1
Reviews.Content: The chambermaids in the hotel are thieves. I stayed in hotel for 3 days with my family. All luggages were kept lock except one of the hand baggage. Last day only one of my expensive sun-glasses and watch were stolen. I have more than one pair of sun-glasses and watch, so i didn't realize that time. However my I reached back home than I found that these things were missing. I was lucky that i kept all other valauables inside the locked luggage, otherwise i would be in big mess. Hotel is otherwise is fine, but I personally recommend that do not leave any valuables even small things in open inside the room. I am feeling so bad that I don't want to come back to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice!”
Reviews.Author: bigprop
Reviews.Content: A great hotel very near to the Vatican Museum and Metro Line A (for getting into city centre). Friendly staff (a rarity from what we saw in Rome!), clean if rather small rooms and a great breakfast to set you up for the day. My only complaint was that our room had an conecting (locked) door to the ajoining room which meant we could hear every word that next door where saying. Would certainly consider staying there again though. Some good local restuarants and bars near the hotel - much cheaper than central Rome

Reviews.Title: “Strongly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: b.c.f.c.1875
Reviews.Content: Two couples from Birmingham, UK. We stayed at the Hotel Spring House, Roma for a long weekend. My husband and I took our friends for their first visit to Italy. The location of the hotel was perfect! Right next to the Vatican museum and in close proximity to the Metropolitano and plenty of eating places. The hotel organised a taxi to pick us up from the airport with an agreed price of 50 Euros, which was inclusive of 4 passengers and two small suitcases. Our driver, Guiseppe, was very friendly and gave us some good advice on places to eat and sites to see. He also took us back to the airport home. Breakfast consisted of a wide range of foods and beverages and catered a variety of tastes. Although the dining room was rather small, it seemed to accomodate all guests, as not everyone wishes to eat at the same time. Our rooms were on the small size, but were nicely decorated, very clean, well maintained and had the benefit of a balcony. Having a mini bar in the room was good and had complimentary mineral waters included. Tea and coffee making facilites were also to hand. Staff are very friendly, helpful and professional. They seem to have thought of everything a guest may need whilst away from home. We had a great time and look forward to going again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, but Clean”
Reviews.Author: moochiebeth
Reviews.Content: I had done extensive research on the net to find a nice hotel near the Vatican before our trip. The Spring House was highly recommended by most sites and it turned out to be great. At first arrival it seemed in a bad neighborhood, rather dirty streets, grafatti walls, crazy parking, lots of sirens. But after a few days we came to realize this is ROME. The outside of the hotel is not enticing, but the inside is clean and crisp. The rooms are very small but clean. The location is perfect for the Vatican around the corner, up the steps and you are at the museum entrance. The metro is a few blocks the other direction and the entire city of Rome is much smaller than I expected and we walked everywhere! We saw so many exciting sites in only 7 days which included a bus tour to Pompeii, Hadrians Villa and the catacombs. All other stops were by metro or foot. I fell in Love with Rome and loved it much more than Paris or London. I can't wait to take my husband and kids. This trip was shared with my mother in law and our former exchange student from Berlin flew down for a few days. Breakfast was included with hot/cold variety, lots of fruit. The restaurants around the hotel are very good including the Mexican one directly across the street. The front desk was helpful and the maids and maintenance personel were trustworthy and very through. Hope this helps your plans.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane74
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a surprise weekend to Rome where we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Reception staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful. Infact, all staff were great from the porter, to the chambermaids and bar-staff. Hotel was spotlessly clean and well presented. The room we had was a little on the small side but had a balcony, which was a nice touch and there was a choice of pillows available. Big bonus was that mineral water in the mini-bar was free and regularly replaced - perfect for thirsty tourists after lots of sight-seeing! Comfortable bed ensured a good nights rest. The location of the hotel is good - right next to the Vatican museums and a short walk to St Peter's Square. Public transport appeared to be easily accesible and regular though I can't comment on service as husband and I preferred to walk everywhere! Breakfast was plentiful in choice and supply. Infact the only reason I have given an average score instead of anything higher is that the bar was very small and located next to reception. There were only a few tables and chairs with very little ambience. It was something that could only be enjoyed by a few people. This was also the only place where you could order food as there was no in-house restaurant. While I appreciate and agree that Rome is a huge place with a wide variey of eateries...people like myself who were tired after a whole day's sight-seeing had to force the energy to go back out in search of dinner... All in all it was a very pleasant stay, I would return and would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Trekker512
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights to coincide with Wales playing (losing) a Six Nations rugby match to Italy. Three couples in our party. One person with some minor mobility issues and occasional use of a wheelchair. The hotel is what it claims to be. Situated close to the Vatican it is ideal for anyone with that as a central theme for their stay. As this was a rugby trip (even with the wife) we wanted some bars locally. There are some cafe's etc but the area isn't really ready for that. We would have been better off somewhere more central on the other side of the river. There are some nice (not too pretentious) restaurants locally that were excellent. Sorry can't remember the names. The hotel staff are excellent, the place recently renovated to a sort of modern style. Breakfasts OK - but we expected better. We travel a lot and like to experience local fare. The quality was just average. The lift is small and if you are on the sixth floor as we were you will need it - or an oxygen bottle (12 flights of stairs). Would anticipate problems when lots of people are using the lift. Also may be very tight if you need a wheelchair. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “mugged in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ant5
Reviews.Content: This is my honest review of the hotel and Rome.We had a city room which was adequate in size with the basic amenities although the shower was small even for a size 10! The room was hot and you could not regulate the temperature and the walls were so thin you could hold a conversation with the people in the next room.The first night we were unlucky to have a screaming child next door,I love children but not crying at 2am.The staff were friendly and the breakfast was plentiful. The hotel is convenient for the Vatican museum and St.Peters church,were on the first day my wife was mugged by 2 gypsies who took a wallet out of a handbag which was worn across the body.It all happened so quick in a crowded walkway alongside the Vatican wall.It is an amazing city but at the tourist hot spots beware of sellers who do not understand the word no.We found the hop on hop off Rome open tour bus good value 20euro for 48 hours,but note were you get on again.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: GILLYB007.
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 days in Rome and here is a truthful review. The Best Western Spring House Hotel is very clean. We booked a Superior Room and it was not big enough to swing a cat in but it did have a balcony. The shower was tiny and our friends who came in with us (who had the same type of room) could not even fit in it! The minibar was free which consisted of soft drinks, water and sparkling wine and beer which was free. The rooms were extremely hot and you could not turn the heating off. We had to sleep with the balcony door open all night which was fine apart from the fact there is night club over the road and all the smokers have to come out for a puff so it is very noisy - with the door shut you cannot hear anything. There are apparently two types of superior rooms and the others on our floor were huge which we only discovered on the last night so be aware. You are given a choice of pillows which is great if you want feather / hypo allergenic etc. The breakfast was good, fresh, plentiful offering both hot and cold etc. The staff were helpful and nothing was too much trouble. However, although all past reviews said this was an ideal location. I think that we would rather have been more in the middle of things. The area around the Best Western is about 10-15 Mins walk to the Vatican but after 8pm it is quite dead. We did go back one day just after 5pm and the place comes to life with great shops - we thought better than the Via Del Corso / Condotti unless you of course want designer shops. Rome is still great after 27 years although it has changed. HOP on/Hop Off Buses a good Idea. Best Ice Cream ever - the Bridge facing the entrance of the Vatican Museum - the Italians were queuing for it which is always a good sign and now we know why - even the nuns indulge!!! The queues for the Vatican Museum are HUGE in the mornings but we walked past at about 2pm and walked straight in. The paintings are truly wonderful. The history is fantastic. We had a meal in the Piazza Navona which was OK and cost for four 270 euros and to be honest we had tasted a lot better. We found out that Valentinos has a great reputation for food and is reasonable for what it is and seems to come highly recommended - there is a dress code. The Trevi Fountain is good apart from the lookey lookey men trying to sell you half dead roses / toys and take your picture - a no does not seem to suffice which is a shame when really all you want to do is look at the beauty of the fountain. This is a wonderful city ad one we would definately return to although not by Ryannair - return flights were cancelled and there really was a lack of information. All other flights were OK.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay for wedding guests...”
Reviews.Author: camoIreland
Reviews.Content: I just had to write a review to thank the Springhouse for such a wonderful stay for my 19 wedding guests. The staff are just fantastic with nothing being any bother. I booked all the rooms through Sabrina (at reservations) through email and she was always helpful and willing to give advice etc. The hotel is located very near the Vatican museums and is within easy reach by taxi to all the tourist spots. The hotel is very clean and a cosy/homely hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and once again i must mention the staff at the hotel who were just fantastic. All my guests complimented how they really enjoyed their stay at the Springhouse.

Reviews.Title: “special anniversary”
Reviews.Author: galingor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Spring House Hotel from 27th to 30th January 2007. Our trip to Rome was to celebrate our Pearl Wedding Anniversary (30 years) and we had he most wonderful time - the hotel was first class and the staff were so friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend it to anyone. The price is very reasonable and the room was lovely. Situated just a few minutes' walk away from the Vatican Museum and St Peter's - it was ideal - especially at night as we walked round to St Peter's to see everything lit up - the magnificent Christmas tree and Nativity Scene were fantastsic. Also the hotel is very near to the metro - which we used to get to everywhere - only a few minutes to each wonderful sight in Rome. Stay at this hotel - you will enjoy it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spring House Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JWynne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Spring House hotel from the 3rd to the 7th February 2007 and loved it. We had room 65 on the top floor with a balcony and side view of the Vatican dome. Breakfast at the hotel was plentiful with cold and hot servings. Minibar in the room with tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer, shower (very snug) and TV with limited UK channels. Try the B-52 cocktail - lovely. The room was spotless, cleaned everyday with fresh towels, toiletries, etc. The staff were excellent, nothing too much trouble. The location was also ver good, close to the metro and within walking distance from the Vatican and shopping area with good restauraunts, try the local Indian and Mexican. Would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolannEssex
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with hotel. Arrived about 1 o'clock and hotel happy for us to leave our bags. On our return they were in our rooms waiting for us. We were a party of four and had two double rooms with queen size beds. Very clean, nice touch on our first night the beds were turned back and four chocolates left out for us. One room had a balcony and was spacious, although the shower room was a bit snug. The second bedroom was not quite so big and no balcony, but again very clean. Tea and coffee topped up regularly. All the staff were extremely helpful and freindly. We were even given a choice of 5 diffent types of pillows to suit individual requirements. Breakfast in the morning was great. Plenty to choose from, and fresh fruit available to take out for the day. Very convienient for sightseeing. Metro very near and only 1 euro for a single trip. Once in the city city is easy to walk around to the various sites or hop a tram. Best restaurant we enjoyed was about 10 mins walk from hotel and called Il Colibri, In Via Famagosta. The food was excellent,we were made to feel very welcome, and the price was very good. Mostly locals in there. On our last day we were being picked up at 6 o'clock and the hotel stored our bags in a locked room and gave us a ticket to retrieve them. We were then able to go out for the rest of the day knowing that our bags were safe. We would definately recommend this hotel as good value for money, and location.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSPSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel!!!!!!!!!!!, very charming, very clean.....7 minutes walking until line A ( subway), so you can go everywhere....the localization is perfect...quiet street , center....the staff speaks english...breakfast is great!!!!!, and the price is good, i paid around 100 euros for a double room, if i go back to rome, for sure i will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: misscappuccino
Reviews.Content: Great choice for our family of five, 2 adults & 3 teenagers. we booked a Superior double room and a triple room for the teenagers. The double was a bit small not to much room around the bed to walk but ok. The triple room was spacious. Size of rooms standard for Europe. With our room upgrade the hotel allowed us to have anything and everything unlimited from the mini bar, that was perfect since the street vendors and cafes charge anywhere from 2-5 euros for a water or cola drink. The staff is very helpfull and nice. Both of our rooms had a balcony with chairs and small table overlooking the front of the hotel we could see the Vatican wall from our balcony. The American-Italia breakfast was great, eggs, Italian bacon, meat links, cereals, cakes and fresh fruit etc.... we looked forward to breakfast. The shower is small but it works must lift legs up to wash can not bend over in the shower. Location to Vatican very close. Other attractions futher away, metro stop 5 minute walk. Supermarket 3 minute walk. Great cafe near Vatican called Insulata Ricca located in Pizza del Risorgimento. Huge salads. With very fresh produce, and other light dishes very good prices. The pronto pizza across from the hotel is ok, we ordered takeout from there one evening the prices are fair, they speak very little english. The Hotels room service and food is very good and cheap prices. I would recomend this hotel as a good value for the money we paid 125,00 euros a night for the superior double and 135,00 euros for the triple per night we booked the rooms thru a search engine database that shows what travel site is offering the best price. We spent 6 nights at this hotel. There is a self service laundry close if needed we used it we did not want to take dirty laundry on to Venice were we were to spend 5 more days. The laundry service is pricey wash 4,00 euros and dry 4,00 euros for 21 minutes of drying time. I would recomend this hotel and I would book this hotel again if I were to return to Rome. Melinda Salinas, CA USA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, well priced.”
Reviews.Author: westwilshire
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little hotel, well situated for touring the Vatican area, and with easy access to the Metro. We had a small but well appointed room. It had a small bathroom, but it was fine. The room was well decorated, modern and the staff was polite and responsive. The breakfast was well presented, the dining area was a little small, try to arrive near the end of serving time and there are plenty of tables. My only complaint is that the room was fairly noisy, but that was partly the extremely loud elderly tourists in our adjoining room! Overall, excellent hotel and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Vatican Museum”
Reviews.Author: alliesun98
Reviews.Content: The Spring House hotel was a great little place! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was small, but clean with a nice sized bathroom. The included breakfast was wonderful, and they had a great selection. The hotel arranged transportation for us from the airport and stowed our luggage after we checked out since our departing flight was not until late in the evening. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the Vatican Museum, and just a little farther from St. Peter's. There are several hop-on/hop-off tour buses that depart from just outside St. Peter's, so we walked to one of the stops and used the bus to tour around the city and see the other major sites (colosseum, pantheon, etc). The only complaint is that there is only one very slow, very inadequate elevator, and we ended up hiking up and down the stairs to our 4th floor hotel room a few times after waiting for an elevator that never came. Other than that, I give this hotel two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Fitzer1977
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed at this Hotel for three days a few weeks ago. The standard of service in this hotel was nothing less than excellent. The staff were very helpful. The breakfast options were quite broad. I will be returning to this hotel given it's excellent location, just five minutes walk from the Vatican museums. On Guilio Cesare street you will find a restaraunt of the same name which we found to be very reasonably priced, with good service and good food. The standard was sigificantly above any other restaurant we visited. After leaving the hotel we realised we had left a set of souveneirs in the lobby area. I requested thse items be sent on, and they arrived a few days later. With all these positive points considered we will be returning to stay at this hotel. General Notes & tips: The 492 bus will take you from an area very close to the hotel (Via Andrea Doria I think) to Via Rinasciamento. Close to Rinasciemento you will find the church of San Luigi Dei Francesci where there are three Carravaggio paintings. Nearby is the church of San Agostino where I think there is one more Carravagio. Didn't have time for the second church unfortunately. The 40 or 62 buses were really useful also.
