This bus took us from near Via Dei Corrodori or Via Concializione (sorry about the vagueness) down as far a Gesu. We could walk from there to the Pantheon, Sant Ignazio di Loyola, Trevi Fountain. The Palazzo Doria Pamphlij (of Via Del Corso near Piazz Venezia) is around this area as well and is definitely worth a visit. The hotel is well located with regard to the Metro. We walked as far as Ottaviano San Pietro station (10 minutes) but there is another station even closer. We took the metro to the Colloseum one morning. We walked through the Forum and back up to Piazza Venezia. At this point we were close to where the 62 bus stops on the Via Del Corso.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed ourselves.”
Reviews.Author: KGBS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five comfortable nights in a small spotless room with a balcony. We had a good choice of food and drink at the buffet breakfast every day and we were offered freshly made alternatives too - cappuchino or latte. The staff in the bar and dining room were helpful and pleasant, as were the people on reception. It was not too far to walk over the river to the main tourist sites, but if you are doing a lot of walking take shoes that can cope with uneven pavements and cobbles or you suffer!! For exploring around the Vatican or Castello St Angelo areas the hotel is in a good situation and the nearby Metro is useful for things further afield, like the Colliseum. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location was excellent”
Reviews.Author: smy001
Reviews.Content: The location was great. Because the hotel is so close to the Vatican, we walked into St Peters Basilica at 5:00 pm (no line up) and observed a Sunday evening service with a 100 male-female choir, visited the Sistine Chapel & Museum on Tuesday at 2:30 pm (15 minute lineup) and saw the Pope’s Wed. 10:30 am service at St Peters Square. It’s a 10 min. walk to the subway and an easy ride to all the tourist sights, i.e. the Spanish steps (4th stop) and Colosseum (9th stop). Breakfast, service and room (7th floor with balcony) were good. The elevator however did not work one day and the roof air condition next to our room was very noisy. I was not impressed considering the room rate. I would still recommend this hotel but ask for a room in one of the lower floors (say 5th floor) and bring earplugs

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fauberte
Reviews.Content: This hotel did everything right from my arrival to my departure. I requested a room earlier than the normal check-in and they did provide the room. The room was perfectly clean. Small by american standard but Ok for Europe. AC was working fine and the rate was extremely competitive. The staff was extremely helpful for any tips or question, the breakfast room was nice with plenty of choices in the morning. Location is a 5 minutes walk from the Vatican in a safe area and most important, in a quiet street close to the major boulevards. A subway station is about 5 minutes of walk from the hotel which was very convenient to travel further. A step walk from the old rome or Coliseum(take the subway!!!) but you can't be closer than this for the Vatican. Coming back to Rome, I will certainly go back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiAdiFridi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2006. We loved this place. Our room was quite small, but was beautifully clean and had everything we needed, including a king size bed and (much needed) air conditioning. Good position, being only a 5 minute walk from the Vatican museum entrance and 10 minute walk to the nearest tube station. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Don't expect a full english breakfast here - although there is a great selection of cereals, fruit, yoghurt, and there was a hot plate with scrambled egg, bacon and sausage but this was of the European style - but we liked it. definitely recommend it and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoversackjack
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in early July with my husband and 2 kids. Beautiful hotel, super helpful staff and a gorgeous breakfast too. Highly recommended.....

Reviews.Title: “Easy and Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: ElaineMR
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Italy and ended with a three night stay at the Best Western Hotel Spring House in Rome. All of our accommodations in Italy were terrific and we were not disappointed with the Spring House. We were delighted with our family room; very clean, comfortable, great balcony views, and a quick walk to the Vatican Museums and St. Peter's Square. The included breakfast was just right with a variety of foods, and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with any questions we had regarding transportation or sightseeing tours. We loved the location and enjoyed walking the surrounding area. We would love to return to Rome and would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loacation (Near Vatican), service, breakfast, all great!”
Reviews.Author: gbofly
Reviews.Content: This is a very fine facility 2 blocks from the Vatican city walls and the Vatican museum entrance. Fairly quiet by Roman standards. Our 5th floor room was nicely decorated and supplied including balcony with table, chairs and a view of the dome of St. Peter's. In room safes were very helpful for stashing our passports and laptop. One adventure was our "attacking shower"- actually it was just unusual and surpised w all the different angles that water could come at you from. The hotel provides an excellent full HOT breakfast; the hostess was gracious and attentive. Staff was helpful all-around. TIP: We took a taxi from the Rome train station to the hotel (priced a couple of drivers, found one for 15 euros), however the subway 'metro' trains would have cost about 2 euros and taken us about 2 blocks from the hotel. Walking Rome appears very safe. We discovered that the metro subways close early (after 10pm) so we walked from the Pantheon back about 2 or 3 miles back to Vatican city in the dark, thankfully with a map. We had no trouble and had a great walk. TIP: The restaurants around the Pantheon are great. Our best dinner in Italy was in a cafe cluster 1 block from the Pantheon. We recommend avoiding the Mexican restaurant acoss the street - we know, we kmow, who would go for Mexicanfood in Rome,but it was late and was the only place we found open near the Hotel. See our pictures attached to get a feel for this highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate and close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: kkmrag
Reviews.Content: BW Hotel Spring House in Rome is more than adequate for a nice stay without breaking the bank. The hotel is 2 blocks from the Vatican, appears to have just been remodeled, has air conditioning, a great buffet breakfast, courteous English-speaking staff. We stayed for 2 nights in late June and had no big problems there. It was easy to find from the AutoStrada (it's not walking distance from the train station) and there is metered parking on the street (1 euro per hour from 800-1900) and the hotel can make arrangements for other parking. Initially, we had a room where the AC was not working well. We talked to the reception desk and was switched to another room that was much cooler. We tried a restaurant recommended by the hotel (Cul de Sac) which was ok, but found a much better one near the Colesseum called Imperiali. The only drawback is a very small shower. It's a bit of a hike to other attractions such as Spanish Steps, Roman Forum, Palatine Hill, but the metro and bus are close by (just beware the metro closes at 2100) Overall a very pleasant stay, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: eva10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 3 night on May 27-30, 2006 the Best western Spring house. The hotel room was small which is typical for European hotels, but the rooms were extremilly clean. They put fresh white linens everyday. The staff in the front desk was great and very helpful. Even though, I spoke Italian thay were very nice and explained everything in English so my husband could understand as well. The hotel is literally 1 block away from the Vatican musem. The Metro and the bus are a 5 minute walk. The area is very quiet, and there are some very nice mom and pop type of restaurant that are cheaper then Via Veneto, but serve great food. This hotel was a great location if Vatican is in your priority list, especially since the lines to get into the Vatican are very long, and they start ealy in the morning. One great thing was that the hotel made a great hot breakfast. They also had great cappuccino and espresso but remember to ask the waitress fron them since the machine is inside their kitchen. I would definitelly recomand staying here. I had never been in a best western hotel, since we are normally Marriot or Swiss hotel type of people, but as I found out later, in Europe Best Western is considered as a Nice Category Hotel Chain. Rome is so large and there is so much walking involved due to sightseeing that I considered staying here since the room was the place when we crashed to sleep afrer each exchausting days. So great staff, very clean, great breakfast, and greatly priced for Rome. Have a great stay!!!
